Job Responsibilities: Are you ready to get ahead in your career? We want to empower you to turn your ambitions into achievements. We thrive in inclusiveness, diversity and embrace close collaborations for you to create impact for yourself and others. Together, we aim to bring the best of technology to help people, businesses and the nation to be ahead in a changing world. To realise our vision to become Malaysia’s leading converged solutions company, we are looking for a new talent to innovate and grow with us in a culture that values commitment, performance and possibilities. Why does this job exist and why is it critical? The Delivery Operations Controller plays a pivotal role in driving excellence across the entire delivery lifecycle by transforming operational insights into actionable strategies. This role requires a highly analytical mindset, with expertise in risk anticipation, issue management, resource optimization, and process improvement. By leveraging data as a support tool, the Controller ensures that operations are consistently optimized and that key insights are accessible to enhance decision-making across the organization. What are you accountable for? Lead initiatives to streamline delivery operations, reduce bottlenecks, and improve productivity. Develop frameworks for continuous improvement, ensuring alignment with business objectives. Set standards for operational performance, establishing governance practices and monitoring key metrics to maintain alignment with organizational goals and best practices. Analyze operational data to identify trends, inefficiencies, and opportunities for optimization across delivery processes, providing actionable insights to support efficiency. Partner with cross-functional teams to gather, organize, and streamline data from diverse sources, ensuring accuracy, relevance, and alignment with business intelligence goals. Establish clear data requirements and continuous feedback loops to enhance data-driven decision-making. Develop and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards and reports to provide visually clear and actionable insights that support informed decision-making, following best practices in data visualization and user experience. Transform raw data from sources such as databases, APIs, and Excel into structured, insightful reports. Use Power BI for data modelling and integration, simplifying complex data for actionable insights. Design and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards and reports, prioritizing clarity and relevance to support informed decision-making. Apply best practices in data visualization to enhance user experience and insight accessibility. Lead training initiatives to improve data entry, structure, and usage across teams, facilitating efficient use within Power BI models. Provide clear guidelines and training sessions to support data accuracy and reliability. What do you need for the role? No formal education requirement, provided the candidate is an expert in Power BI and can create high-quality, actionable dashboards. 2-3 years of hands-on experience with Power BI (or exceptional skills demonstrated through project work for fresh graduates). Strong proficiency in Power BI, including DAX queries, Power Query, and data modelling. Proven ability to transform complex data into clear, actionable insights that support business decision-making. Familiarity with Power Automate, Power Apps, and API integration for enhanced automation. Experience with databases, such as SQL Server or Azure, for data sourcing and integration. Knowledge of data warehousing and ETL processes (preferred). Advanced data visualization and storytelling skills. Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving capabilities. Excellent communication skills for effectively collaborating with stakeholders and presenting insights. Ability to independently manage multiple priorities and projects. Familiarity with report optimization best practices and ensuring data consistency. Attention to detail and strong organizational skills. What’s next? Once you’ve applied online, our team will carefully review your application. Due to a high volume of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a fair and timely review process. Should you be shortlisted for the role, we will send you an invitation via email for a digital interview. You can also check on your application status by logging into your candidate account. Maxis values diverse voices & people. We hire and reward our employees based on capability & performance — regardless of ethnicity, gender, age, education, religion, nationality or physical ability.

Responsibilities TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo. Why Join Us Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Join us. About the Team The success of TikTok's data business model hinges on the supply of a large volume of high quality labeled data that will grow exponentially as our business scales up. However, the current cost of data labeling is excessively high. The Data Solutions team is built to understand data strategically at scale for all Global Business Solution (GBS) business needs. Data Solutions Team uses quantitative and qualitative data to guide and uncover insights, turning our findings into real products to power exponential growth. Data Solutions Team responsibility includes infrastructure construction, recognition capabilities management, global labeling delivery management. About the Role Product Specialist will serve as a bridge between Business Partners (BPs), and their business lines, and the product team. They will work collaboratively with each other, BPs and requestors, to understand the intricacies of labelling for each business line, assessing current and incoming projects for suitability, blockers faced, and creatively problem solved for workarounds to help maximise utilisation. Product Specialist will take ownership of onboarding for each of their business lines, and should be capable stakeholder managers, as well as have some grounding in data analytics or scientific experimentation. Responsibilities 1. Product support - Develop product and platform expertise, working closely with Engineering, Product, and Operations teams to diagnose and resolve user issues; 2. Product operations - Strategically optimise and scale support processes to enhance efficiency and improve the overall user experience, incorporating data-driven insights and metrics; 3. Product documentation - Create and refine documentation to empower users to resolve issues via self-service, reducing dependency on support teams; 4. Project onboarding - Own project creation, creative solutioning of workarounds, conduct testing of queues and RCA of project blockers; 5. Labelling experiments - Design and run A/B tests on current templates to identify the best and most optimal designs in support of the efficiency improvements of the platform. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications 1. 1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience; 2. Strong project management and cross-department communication skills; 4. Strong analytical skills, aptitude to independently learn new technologies; 5. Proficient skills in Excel, familiar with formulas, pivot tables, reports and presentations. Preferred Qualification 1. Good information analysis, data deep dive and interpretation capability; 2. Excellent problem-solving, task prioritization, follow-up, and eager learner; 3. Ability to use SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are preferred; 4. Fluent in English (written and verbal) and other languages is a plus. TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too. #LI-SP6

Our client is a leading global insurance player. Job Description We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Data Strategy Analyst to support the strategic development and implementation of data and AI initiatives across our insurance business. The Data Strategy Analyst will play a pivotal role in shaping company's future by leveraging data to drive strategic business decisions. This position is instrumental in enhancing operational efficiency, improving customer experiences, and fostering innovation across the organization. Key Responsibilities Strategic Planning and Support: Assist in developing and executing the company's Data strategy, aligning with overall business objectives. Documents Preparation: Draft papers, presentations, executive briefs, and other strategic documents for internal and external stakeholders. Stakeholder Engagement: Prepare decks and papers for key forums and meetings, effectively communicating complex data concepts to senior management and stakeholders. Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with various departments to align data initiatives with business goals, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement. Performance Measurement: Develop and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the impact of data initiatives on business outcomes. Required Skills and Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, or a related field. Masters degree is a plus. Minimum 2 years of proven consultancy experience in data related work. Understanding of data governance and AI technologies. Familiarity with the insurance industry and large-scale data initiatives is a plus. Knowledge of Power BI or similar analytics tools is a plus. Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills, capable of navigating and addressing complex business challenges. Exceptional ability to prepare and present decks and papers, conveying complex technical information in a clear and compelling manner. Strong team player with excellent interpersonal skills, capable of working effectively with cross-functional teams.

What you'll be doing? Model Development: Design and build scalable machine learning models that drive innovation and solve complex problems. Data Analysis: Dive into diverse datasets, preparing and preprocessing information to fuel powerful model training. Model Optimization: Train, validate, and fine-tune machine learning models to achieve peak performance and accuracy. Deployment Expertise: Bring models to life by deploying them into production and seamlessly integrating with existing systems. Performance Monitoring: Keep a vigilant eye on model performance, ensuring continued accuracy and relevance through updates. Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and product managers to deliver impactful solutions. Continuous Learning: Stay ahead of the curve by researching the latest developments in machine learning and AI. Who are they looking for? Educational Background: A degree in a relevant field, demonstrating a strong foundation in machine learning concepts. Experience: At least 2 years of hands-on experience in machine learning or related areas. Language Proficiency: Fluency in Bahasa Malaysia, English, and Mandarin to facilitate effective communication. Technical Prowess: Expertise in scikit-learn, JAX, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Java, Go, and Python to tackle diverse technical challenges. Why you should consider this opportunity? Company Description About SEEK SEEK’s portfolio of diverse businesses, which includes Jobstreet and Jobsdb in Asia, make a positive impact on a truly global scale. Our purpose is to help people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and help organisations succeed. We create world-class technology solutions to connect more people to relevant employment, education, small business and volunteer opportunities. We have a culture of high-performance in our workplaces and celebrate the diversity of our employees who contribute to the success of our organisation. Life at SEEK SEEK’s purpose is at the centre of everything we do. Our SEEK, which defines the way we work, is all about what makes us unique and a little bit different. Passion, Team, Delivery and Future are our principles that drive innovation and creativity. SEEK strives to support employee wellbeing by providing an amazing experience at work which led us to being named AFR BOSS Top 10 Best Place to Work 2023 In Tech (third year in a row). In Malaysia, where SEEK’s Asia HQ is located, we received four accolades at the TalentCorp Life at Work Awards 2023, including first runner-up for Best International Organisation and champion for Best CHRO. Job Description The Role The Data Scientist role is based in Kuala Lumpur within the Artificial Intelligence Platform Services (AIPS) team. The team is structured into cross-disciplinary squad with members from Data Science, Strategy and Engineering who work together to research, design, build and support end-to-end machine learning based products delivering direct value to hirers and job seekers. Successful performance in this role will be demonstrated through the business value contributed by developed and supported products. Further, the successful candidate will be expected to stay up to date with emerging techniques in Natural Language Processing (NLP)and machine learning, and be deeply involved in a culture of continual improvement. This role will report to a Senior Data Scientist / Principal Data Scientist within AIPS. AIPS has a matrix structure where your direct line manager will act as a coach and technical mentor but your day-to-day activity will be determined by the squad priorities. Key Responsibilities Forming clear data addressable problem statements from current business problems Gathering, validating and understanding data relevant to the problem statement Designing and building data transformation pipelines and machine learning algorithms to solve the business problem Working with product management and other business stakeholders to review and iterate data products to fit emerging market trends Evangelising appropriate ML methods and explaining them, and their associated benefits and limitations to team members from Engineering and Strategy. Qualifications Essential Qualifications, Skills and Experience Post graduate qualification in a quantitative field (e.g. Physics, Mathematics, Bioinformatics, Computer Science) Advanced data extraction and processing skills using SQL, Spark, etc Familiarity with S3, EC2 and/or EMR in AWS. About You CARSOME is searching for a Data Scientist who thrives on unraveling complex business challenges through data analysis. You'll be an innately curious and highly analytical individual, adept at translating business problems into technical requirements and extracting meaningful insights from data. If you possess these qualities and are excited about using your data expertise to solve real-world challenges, consider applying! Your Day-to-Day Understand business processes deeply, identify opportunities where data science can add value, and solve problems using advanced statistical analyses or machine learning techniques as necessary, including prescriptive analytics and predictive modelling Initiate, design and lead projects to maximise business impact with the right data driven solution across business functions, including pricing and inventory (e.g. price prediction and optimization), operations (e.g. computer vision automation), customer conversion (e.g. recommendation and personalisation engine), etc. Responsible for ensuring successful end-to-end delivery and maintenance of machine learning, data science and AI initiatives, including measurement of model performance in action and monitoring for drifts over time Work with MLOps engineers in developing machine learning pipelines to streamline and automate the deployment of models. Ensure timely high standard delivery of output and documentation Design and execute experiments iteratively to improve the performance of data science solutions deployed Propose framework and drive hypothesis validation, ensuring statistically sound decision making from proper A/B test setups whenever feasible Work with Product & Tech teams across organisations to enhance data collection process as necessary Your Know How Innately curious, highly analytical and enjoy distilling complex business problems into technical requirements and find answers in the data At least 3 years of practical experience in data science, advanced business analytics, machine learning, AI or computer vision Experience in the complete modelling lifecycle, from ideation to deployment and continual monitoring and maintenance Proficient in Python and/or R. Preferably Python Comfortable using SQL for data exploration, and analysis. Preferably familiar with Google BigQuery or similar Result-oriented and resourceful. You can cut to the core of a problem, identify what needs to be done, and work with the teams to make things happen Constructive communication of ideas, issues, and solutions in a team environment Self-starter who is extremely motivated to continue learning and growing, able to pick up new skills quickly Experience in MLOps framework, cloud services by AWS/ GCP, Tensorflow/ Pytorch will be an advantage. Experience in the automotive or e-commerce industry Experience working at a tech startup or fast-growing organisation Experience in computer vision or AI research

As a Smart Manufacturing Data Scientist 2 at Micron, you will employ techniques and theories drawn from areas of mathematics, statistics, semiconductor physics, materials science, and information technology to uncover patterns in data from which predictive models, actionable insights, and solutions can be developed. You will interact with expert Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Business Areas Engineers, and UX teams for data analysis projects and improvement of existing tools. There will be significant opportunities to perform exploratory and new solution development activities. Join us today to embark your career opportunity! Roles & Responsibilities Designs, develops and programs methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze unstructured, diverse “big data” sources to generate actionable insights and solutions for client services and product improvement. Interacts with product and service teams to identify questions and issues for data analysis and experiments. Develops and codes software programs, algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources. Identifies meaningful insights from large data and metadata sources; interprets and communicates insights and findings from analysis and experiments to product, service, and business managers. Strong desire to grow a career as a Data Scientist in highly automated industrial manufacturing doing analysis and machine learning on terabytes and petabytes of diverse datasets. Experience in the areas: statistical modeling, feature extraction and analysis, supervised/unsupervised/semi-supervised learning. Exposure to the semiconductor industry is a plus but not a requirement. Requirements Ability to extract data from different databases via SQL and other query languages and applying data cleansing, outlier identification, and missing data techniques. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Machine learning and other sophisticated analytical methods Proficiency in Python and/or R pySpark and/or SparkR and/or SparklyR Hadoop (Hive, Spark, HBase) Teradata and/or another SQL databases Tensorflow, and/or other statistical software including scripting capability for automating analyses SSIS, ETL Javascript, AngularJS 2.0, Tableau

Job Responsibilities: Responsible for developing a robust machine learning model for credit scoring that is highly scalable and compliant with BASEL II guidelines. Re-evaluate credit risk model performance on a periodic basis for retraining using statistics such as probability of default, confusion matrix, f1&f2 score, Lorenz Curve, Kolmogorov–Smirnov, GINI and AUC. Develop innovative data science methodologies to manage credit risk of the lending portfolio. Familiar techniques for implementing and automating continuous integration (CI), continuous delivery (CD), and continuous training (CT) for machine learning (ML) systems Synthesize requirements from stakeholders, develop innovative and effective approaches in collaboration with data engineers, Machine learning engineers, product managers, and technical teams. Contribute to core advanced analytics and machine learning platforms and tools by research, discover new methodologies and new data feeds to support credit decisioning and other key business processes. Identifies what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources, leveraging new data collection processes to discover new data feeds with predictive power to derive borrower credit worthiness. Understand data sources, conduct data discovery, apply complex techniques to produce features for automation using a hypothesis driven approach. Any other ad hoc task as assigned from time to time. Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or Engineering, or in a related field, a Master’s degree is will be an additional advantage. Minimum 3-5 years’ of relevant experience. Experience in all or some of the following scripting languages: SQL, Python, R, SAS, Java, C++, SPSS, MATLAB. Strong business understanding and the ability to translate business requirements into data science solutions effectively. *Our recruitment team will reach out to shortlisted candidates only.

Build Predictive Models: Develop, train, and optimize machine learning models for forecasting, classification, and recommendation systems. Data-Driven Insights: Translate complex data into actionable insights to support business strategies. Experimentation & A/B Testing: Design and implement controlled experiments to measure the impact of changes. Data Visualization: Communicate findings effectively using tools like Tableau, Power BI. Collaborate with Stakeholders: Work closely with business teams, product managers, and engineers to integrate data science solutions into decision-making processes. Model Deployment: Work with Data Engineers to deploy and monitor machine learning models in production environments. Requirements: Candidate with at least Master's or PhD’s in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science or related field with 6 to 10 years of experience. Strong programming skills in Python or R. Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and analysis. Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks Deep understanding of statistical analysis, probability, and hypothesis testing. Experience on ML model deployment. Familiarity with data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, Seaborn, Matplotlib). Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities. Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable business strategies. Strong communication and storytelling skills for presenting findings to non-technical stakeholders. Excellent collaboration and teamwork skills.

About FA Controls Sdn Bhd: Office based in the Central Region of Malaysia, FA Controls Sdn Bhd is a leader in delivering engineering services and advanced automation solutions. Meet the team: You will be part of the Global Engineering team within Operations, tasked with end-to-end technical oversight of our manufacturing technologies spanning our suppliers, contract manufactures and automation houses. Including providing technical support for on-market production at our manufacturing sites. You will bring your expertise and passion for plastic injection molding tools design, fabrication and validation. You will play a pivotal role in ensuring robust new product introduction, capacity expansions, and sustained on-market performance. This crucial role supports Dexcom's thrilling growth trajectory in delivering essential, life-changing products to our valued customers. As part of this dynamic and highly effective team, you will collaborate closely across multiple functions, gaining broad exposure to our entire product life cycle. Where you come in: You will apply your expertise in thermoplastic injection molding tool design and fabrication, encompassing machining, surface finishing, and assembly techniques. Conduct validations to ensure robust and sustainable commercial production while implementing improvements to drive enhanced yield, quality, and efficiency. You will have extensive experience in injection molding manufacturing for high-volume Class II medical devices. You will have advanced data analytics and statistical analytics capabilities, inclusive of development of robust DOEs with strong linkage to CPK and PPK requirements. You will have experience in the defining the full injection molding work cell requirements, inclusive of tool and machine design and capabilities such a barrel and shot size with knowledge of their linkage to optimum product manufacturing performance. You will support a range of programs from new product introductions and launches to scale up, on-market, and end of life management. Participating in molded component related development activities, ensuring seamless progression, timely feedback, and optimization, while fostering teamwork and accountability. You will ensure adherence to design, quality, and safety standards, upholding GMP, FDA, and ISO guidelines. As well as lead and support the planning and execution of robust validations and on-market change assessments. You will collaborate closely with the Purchasing and Quality organizations to establish a rigorous supplier selection process, ensuring timely launches and sustained performance at the optimal cost profile. You will guide and provide technical support to suppliers and internal teams, ensuring adherence to sound engineering and operations practices throughout the supply chain, fostering strong partnerships and promoting a culture of excellence and continuous improvement. You will initiate and provide technical insight in the development and implementation of on-market support initiatives, including a robust preventative maintenance management system, to maintain the yield, performance, and quality of products and subcomponents. What makes you successful: You possess exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and make informed decisions. You can work effectively in a team environment, collaborating with cross-functional partners in manufacturing, R&D, supply chain, and quality assurance to achieve common goals. You effectively communicate with internal teams and external partners. This includes conveying technical concepts clearly, providing timely updates, and fostering collaborative relationships to ensure alignment and successful project outcomes. You must be able and capable to travel to our automation vendors and contract manufacturing partners to investigate production or quality related issues and troubleshoot equipment. You collaborate with R&D on design for manufacturing considerations for new product development and work with injection molding toolmakers to provide oversight into mold and part design for high-scale manufacturing. You support the development of productive partnerships for stable on-market performance and drive continuous improvement efforts. You drive innovation in approach, processes, and methodologies while ensuring adherence to company, customer, and industry requirements and specifications. You lead the identification and implementation of technology and process solutions to enhance performance and achieve both short-term and long-term objectives. Key Competencies: Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, plastics engineering, or a related field. Demonstrates extensive technical expertise in plastic injection molding tool, equipment, processes and materials. Proficient in diagnosing and resolving complex mold tool issues, with a proven ability to optimize mold tool designs for superior performance and efficiency. Direct experience in injection molding manufacturing for high volume, Class II medical devices. Expert in statistical process control (SPC) and proficient in using software tools such as Minitab or JMP for data analysis, process troubleshooting and optimization. Proficiency in SolidWorks and MoldFlow analysis. Robust understanding of Plastic Part Design Guidelines, including dimensional tolerancing and GD&T Standards. Demonstrated success in driving continuous improvement initiatives using LEAN, KAIZEN, and Six Sigma methodologies to significantly enhance process efficiency, reduce operational costs, and elevate product quality standards. What you’ll get: A front row seat to life changing CGM technology. Learn about our brave #dexcomwarriors community. A full and comprehensive benefits program. Access to career development through in-house learning programs and/or qualified tuition reimbursement. An exciting and innovative, industry-leading organization committed to our employees, customers, and the communities we serve. Travel Required: 15-25% Experience and Education Requirements: Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline, and a minimum of 8-12 years related experience or Master’s degree and 5-7 years equivalent industry experience or a PhD and 2-4 years of experience.

An exciting and innovative, industry-leading organization committed to our employees, customers, and the communities we serve. Position Summary: The Simulation Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, and implementing simulation models using Python to support operational decision-making and optimization efforts. This role involves creating simulations to model real-world scenarios in areas such as warehouse logistics, manufacturing processes, or supply chain operations. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, build robust simulation frameworks, analyse model outputs, and provide actionable insights for process improvement. Key Responsibilities: 1. Simulation Model Development: Design and develop simulation models using Python to replicate real-world systems and processes, focusing on performance, accuracy, and scalability. Create dynamic models that account for various operational variables (e.g., capacity constraints, resource allocation, lead times). Implement libraries (e.g., SimPy, PySCeS, Pyomo) and frameworks suitable for discrete-event, agent-based, or continuous simulation. 2. Data Integration & Preprocessing: Collect and preprocess data from relevant sources (e.g., databases, APIs, CSV files) to ensure models are based on accurate and up-to-date information. Use Python libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy) for data cleaning, transformation, and analysis, preparing data for integration into simulation models. Validate and refine data inputs to improve model accuracy and ensure results align with real-world operations. 3. Model Testing & Validation: Conduct rigorous testing of simulation models to ensure accuracy, robustness, and reliability. Calibrate models based on historical data and conduct validation exercises to ensure the models’ predictive accuracy. 4. Scenario Analysis & Optimization: Run simulation experiments to analyze various scenarios, test hypotheses, and evaluate the impact of different strategies (e.g., inventory adjustments, scheduling changes). Optimize model parameters to improve key performance metrics such as processing times, resource utilization, and cost savings. Provide recommendations based on simulation outcomes, helping stakeholders make informed decisions. 5. Continuous Learning & Improvement: Keep current with trends and advancements in simulation techniques, Python libraries, and data science methodologies. Experiment with advanced modelling techniques (e.g., machine learning integration, Monte Carlo simulations) to further enhance simulation insights. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, or a related field. 3+ years of experience in Python programming, with a strong focus on simulation development. Proficiency in Python simulation libraries (e.g., SimPy, PySCeS) and data manipulation tools (e.g., Pandas, NumPy). Solid understanding of simulation methodologies (discrete-event, agent-based, Monte Carlo) and optimization techniques. Experience with version control (e.g., Git) and code management practices. Preferred Skills: Experience with visualization libraries (e.g., Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly) for simulation result reporting. Knowledge of cloud computing or distributed computing for running large-scale simulations. Familiarity with database management (SQL) and data integration. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work with complex systems and processes. Excellent communication skills for presenting technical findings to non-technical stakeholders.

Position Overview: As an AI Scientist with a background in digital pathology, you will work at the intersection of AI, machine learning, and pathology. You will be responsible for developing and implementing AI-driven algorithms to analyse digital pathology images and datasets, with the goal of improving diagnostic accuracy, disease prediction, and treatment planning. This is an exciting opportunity to apply your expertise in both AI and pathology to create impactful solutions that can change the landscape of healthcare. Key Responsibilities: Develop and implement machine learning and deep learning models for analysing digital pathology images, including tissue slides, cellular structures, and molecular data. Work closely with pathologists, bioinformaticians, and other domain experts to understand medical requirements and translate them into AI-based solutions. Design and optimize AI algorithms for image segmentation, feature extraction, classification, and prediction in the context of pathology. Utilize large-scale medical datasets (including histopathology, genomics, and clinical data) to train and validate AI models. Conduct rigorous model validation and performance evaluation to ensure clinical relevance, robustness, and generalizability of AI models. Collaborate with research teams to design experiments and analyse results that contribute to scientific publications or patent applications. Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and digital pathology, and propose novel approaches for integrating them into our product development pipeline. Participate in the creation of technical documentation, including reports, user guides, and research papers. Required Qualifications: Ph.D. or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Biomedical Engineering, Computational Biology, or a related field. Strong experience with AI and machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras). Proven experience in digital pathology, including knowledge of medical imaging techniques (e.g., whole-slide imaging, histopathology, immunohistochemistry). Familiarity with image processing and computer vision techniques (e.g., convolutional neural networks, image segmentation). Solid understanding of data preprocessing, feature extraction, and augmentation techniques for medical image analysis. Experience with large-scale biomedical datasets, including clinical data, pathology images, and genomic data. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or MATLAB. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail. Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Requirements: Experience working with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud) for deploying AI models. Familiarity with regulatory standards and ethical considerations in medical AI (e.g., HIPAA, FDA guidelines). Experience in the application of AI to specific pathologies (e.g., oncology, neurology, cardiology) is a plus. A strong publication record in AI or digital pathology is a bonus. What We Offer: Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunity to work on groundbreaking projects with leading experts in the field. A collaborative and innovative work environment. Professional development opportunities and continuous learning. If you are passionate about applying AI to transform digital pathology and make a meaningful impact on healthcare, we encourage you to apply and join our team at MYmAb Biologics. To Apply: Please submit your resume, along with a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and interest in the role, to info.mymab@gmail.com.

Job Responsibilities: Why AirAsia Move Are you ready to take off and be part of AirAsia Move. AirAsia Move is the latest offering from AirAsia Group, focused on leveraging cutting-edge technologies to build and scale data-driven products and services across the travel, e-commerce, and logistics ecosystems. We are transforming the way people experience travel, offering seamless access to travel-related services. As a part of our expansion, we are looking for a talented Lead Data Engineer to join our growing team and help us unlock the full potential of our data capabilities. Key Responsibilities: 1. Data Architecture & Pipeline Development: Lead the design and implementation of scalable, reliable, and optimized data pipelines that enable seamless data ingestion, transformation, and delivery. Architect, build, and manage end-to-end data workflows, ensuring efficient data processing for both real-time and batch systems. Work with stakeholders across product, analytics, and engineering teams to ensure data solutions meet business needs. Optimize and maintain data pipelines for performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency. Lead the design, development, and optimization of MLOps pipelines and infrastructure to streamline the deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of machine learning models at scale. Drive the adoption of best practices for continuous integration, continuous deployment (CI/CD), and automated testing in machine learning workflows. Define and enforce standards for model versioning, governance, and lifecycle management. 2. Model Deployment & Monitoring: Design and implement automated workflows for deploying machine learning models in production environments, ensuring models are delivered on time and meet required performance metrics. Implement model monitoring systems to ensure the ongoing health and performance of models in production, including model drift detection, data quality monitoring, and performance alerting. Work with data scientists to ensure models are deployable, reproducible, and maintainable in production environments. Oversee the operationalization of machine learning models, ensuring scalability, efficiency, and performance of both batch and real-time systems. 3. Cloud Infrastructure & Data Integration: Leverage cloud platforms (e.g., Google Cloud) to build and scale data solutions. Work with various data integration technologies (e.g., APIs, ETL tools, Kafka, Pub/Sub) to ensure seamless data flow between systems. Implement data versioning, lineage, and governance to maintain data integrity, security, and compliance. 4. Data Quality & Monitoring: Ensure that data quality, accuracy, and consistency are maintained across all data pipelines and systems. Implement and monitor data quality checks, logging, and alerting to ensure early detection of issues in the data pipelines. Continuously evaluate and improve data architectures, ensuring data availability and minimizing downtime. 5. Collaboration, Leadership & Team Management: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, engineers, product managers, tech and devops to understand business needs and deliver impactful AI/ML solutions. Lead a team of data and MLOps engineers, providing mentorship, guidance, and performance feedback to foster a collaborative and innovative team culture. Promote best practices in data engineering, code quality, testing, and deployment. Work with senior leadership and other departments to define and prioritize data-related initiatives and align with business objectives. Lead the development of technical roadmaps and strategies for long-term data infrastructure goals. Document processes, workflows, and best practices for knowledge sharing across teams. 7. Innovation & Continuous Improvement: Stay up to date with the latest trends, tools, and technologies in the data engineering space. Propose innovative solutions to improve the speed, quality, and scalability of data systems. Drive a culture of continuous improvement by proactively identifying areas for optimization and automation. Required Qualifications: Education & Experience: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience. 6+ years of hands-on experience in data engineering, including at least 3 years in a leadership or management role. Proven experience in building large-scale, cloud-based data infrastructure and data pipelines for high-volume, high-velocity data. Strong experience with ETL tools, data orchestration frameworks (e.g., Apache Airflow), and batch/streaming data processing (e.g., Apache Kafka, Spark). Expertise in working with cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python, Java, or Scala; experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., BigQuery, MongoDB, PostgreSQL). Deep understanding of data warehousing concepts and experience in designing and managing data models. Proficiency in GCP Services such as Vertex AI, Kubeflow, TensorFlow Extended (TFX), Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE),BigQuery ML, Cloud Functions & Cloud Run, BigQuery, Cloud Storage, Composer, Cloud Pub/Sub & Dataflow, AI Building Blocks, Model Monitoring & Explainability Experience with data governance, data quality, and data privacy best practices. Familiarity with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) and infrastructure-as-code (Terraform, CloudFormation). Soft Skills: Strong leadership, communication, and collaboration skills, with experience managing cross-functional teams. Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities, with a focus on scalability and efficiency. Ability to translate complex technical concepts into business value for non-technical stakeholders. Passionate about mentoring and developing teams to reach their potential.

ABOUT AVERY DENNISON CORPORATION: Avery Dennison Corporation (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science and digital identification solutions company that provides a wide range of branding and information solutions that optimize labor and supply chain efficiency, reduce waste, advance sustainability, circularity and transparency, and better connect brands and consumers. Our products and solutions include labeling and functional materials, radio frequency identification (RFID) inlays and tags, software applications that connect the physical and digital, and a variety of products and solutions that enhance branded packaging and carry or display information that improves the customer experience. Strong problem-solving skills analytical thinking, and effective communication abilities. Ability to work collaboratively in a team and interact professionally with clients.

Full job description Greetings from Accord innovations! We are hiring for Accord innovations Role: Delivery Lead- ITSM Full time job Location: KL, Malaysia and Pune, India Payroll: Accord innovations! Job Title: Solution Architect & Delivery Lead - ITSM Location: Malaysia/India About Us: We are a leading provider of IT services and consulting solutions, specializing in helping businesses optimize their technological investments. We are passionate about delivering innovative and impactful solutions that drive business growth and efficiency. We are a small but dynamic company with a strong focus on client relationships and delivering exceptional service. About the Role: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Solution Architect & Delivery Lead to lead our ITSM (IT Service Management) practice. In this critical role, you will be responsible for leading a team of 15-20 IT professionals, driving the successful delivery of ITSM projects, and shaping the future of our ITSM service offerings. This position can be based in Malaysia or India or Indonesia. Key Responsibilities: Solution Architecture: o Lead the design, development, and implementation of comprehensive ITSM solutions aligned with industry best practices (e.g., ITIL, ISO 20000), incorporating AIOPS (Artificial Intelligence for IT Operations) principles and leveraging the potential of Generative AI. o Analyze client business requirements, identify pain points, and propose innovative ITSM solutions to address their challenges, leveraging AI/ML capabilities for predictive maintenance, anomaly detection, and proactive issue resolution. o Develop and maintain a strong understanding of emerging ITSM technologies and trends, including AI/ML in ITSM, cloud-based ITSM solutions, automation, AIOPS, and Gen AI. o Ensure that all solutions are aligned with client business objectives, budget constraints, and project timelines, considering the potential benefits and risks associated with AI/ML implementations. Delivery Leadership: o Lead and mentor a high-performing team of 15-20 IT professionals, including project managers, consultants, and engineers, fostering a culture of innovation and exploration of AI/ML technologies within the ITSM domain. Oversee the entire project lifecycle, from initial planning and scoping to implementation, testing, and go-live support, ensuring the successful integration of AI/ML capabilities where appropriate. Monitor project progress, identify and mitigate risks, and ensure timely and successful project delivery, leveraging AI/ML tools for predictive risk assessment and proactive issue resolution. Build and maintain strong client relationships, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction, by demonstrating a deep understanding of how AI/ML can enhance customer experience. o Drive continuous improvement within the ITSM practice, identifying areas for process optimization and service enhancement, leveraging AI/ML to analyze operational data and identify areas for improvement. Business Development: o Contribute to the development of new ITSM service offerings, incorporating AIOPS and Gen AI capabilities to differentiate our offerings and provide greater value to clients. Participate in pre-sales activities, including proposal development, client presentations, and solution demonstrations, effectively communicating the value proposition of AI/ML-powered ITSM solutions. o Build and maintain relationships with key industry partners and vendors, including those specializing in AI/ML technologies. Qualifications: Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field. Experience: o 12+ years of experience in IT Service Management, with a strong focus on solution architecture and delivery. Proven experience in implementing and leveraging AI/ML technologies within an IT operations context (e.g., AIOPS, predictive analytics, machine learning for IT) Proven experience leading and mentoring high-performing teams of 15+ professionals. o Deep understanding of ITSM frameworks and methodologies (e.g., ITIL, ISO 20000). with ITSM tools and technologies (e.g., ServiceNow, Jira Service Desk). Skills: o Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills. o Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to think 1 strategically and creatively. Project management and organizational skills. Strong leadership and mentoring skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Strong understanding of AI/ML concepts, including machine learning algorithms, deep learning, natural language processing, and their applications in IT. Certifications: ITIL certifications (e.g., ITIL Expert, ITIL Managing Professional) are highly preferred. Consider certifications related to AI/ML, such as those offered by AWS, Google Cloud, or Microsoft Azure. Benefits: Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunities for professional growth and development. Work in a dynamic and challenging environment. Be part of a passionate and collaborative team. Senior Commercial Operations Manager – Energy Industries At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. This position reports to Hub Asia Sales Support Manager Your role and responsibilities In this role, you will be responsible to formulate competitive commercial proposals, taking into consideration on best available solution / product mix, for each individual opportunity assigned to you. Ensures bids & proposals are well documented in a timely manner and with appropriate level of detail, including full and accurate costs. As the custodian of bids and proposal, you will collaborate with extended stakeholders (i.e., sales, tax, contract management, finance, project, engineering, product & leadership) and ensuring all risk review processes, assessments & approvals are adhered/documented in the preparation of commercial proposals. This role is contributing to the Process Automation Energy Industries Business – Hub Asia Region. The position is based in Petaling Jaya, Malaysia. The work model for the role is: #LI-onsite, #LI-hybrid You will be mainly accountable for: Formulating competitive bids & proposals, considering best available solution / product mix and appropriate technical and commercial considerations for each individual situation. Managing the preparation of all technical (e.g., defining the most suitable technology and product type(s)), financial (e.g., total price sheet, cash flow analysis) and if necessary, project management (e.g., quantifies hours of engineering and commissioning) aspects of the bid/estimate/quotation, indicating prices and trading conditions. In accordance with bid/estimate/quotation planning, ensuring that inputs for editing activities are provided on time and according to established quality procedures. Managing external services to support bid/estimation preparation such as translations and governmental approvals. Collecting and archiving documentation regarding the offer/order and recording assumptions and decisions taken during the development process. Regularly reporting the status of the bids/estimates/quotations using defined tools and collecting and analyzing the reasons for tenders being lost and won. Identifying potential risks in the bids, and estimates, and in any related contract agreements across customers/channels. Providing information and/or participating in the Risk Review process in accordance with ABB policy. Shall be responsible for all T&C discussions with customer. Qualifications for the role Engineering degree with 12-15 years of expertise in Energy Industries. More than 8 years of experience in complex Bids & Proposal. 2-3 years of experience in operations – Project Management would be an added advantage. Extensive experience with Asia Pacific customers in the Oil & Gas, Chemical & Refinery and/or and Power segments. Involvement in MEC / MAC project would be an added advantage. Fluent in English, proficient in Mandarin / Thai / Bahasa is a plus. Team player, self-sufficient and highly motivated. What's in it for you? Get exposed to cutting-edge technology in Process Automation and have a visible impact on the future Benefit from an open and solution-oriented work culture Flexibility: we have hybrid work options, make the best out of them! With its integrated solutions that automate, digitalize and electrify operations, the Division is committed to supporting traditional industries in their efforts to decarbonize. The Division also supports the development, integration and scaling up of new and renewable energy models. The Division’s goal is to help customers adapt and succeed in the rapidly changing global energy transition. Harnessing data, machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI), the Division brings over 50 years of domain expertise delivering solutions designed to improve energy, process and production efficiency, as well as reduce risk, operational cost and capital cost, while minimizing waste for customers, from project start-up and throughout the entire plant lifecycle. The Company Dexcom Corporation (NASDAQ DXCM) is a pioneer and global leader in continuous glucose monitoring (CGM). Dexcom began as a small company with a big dream: To forever change how diabetes is managed. To unlock information and insights that drive better health outcomes. Here we are 25 years later, having pioneered an industry. And we're just getting started. We are broadening our vision beyond diabetes to empower people to take control of health. That means personalized, actionable insights aimed at solving important health challenges. To continue what we've started: Improving human health. We are driven by thousands of ambitious, passionate people worldwide who are willing to fight like warriors to earn the trust of our customers by listening, serving with integrity, thinking big, and being dependable. We've already changed millions of lives and we're ready to change millions more. Our future ambition is to become a leading consumer health technology company while continuing to develop solutions for serious health conditions. We'll get there by constantly reinventing unique biosensing-technology experiences. Though we've come a long way from our small company days, our dreams are bigger than ever. The opportunity to improve health on a global scale stands before us. Position Summary: Partner with both MY and US IT Information Security team to automate backend operation tasks and activities, identify opportunities in existing IT processes that could be made more efficient or effective through automation and develop program application to take advantages of these opportunities. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Design and develop automation solutions/applications to streamline Dexcom Information Security operation and monitoring for Security Engineering critical services. Develop and implement automated solutions/applications to detect suspected security incidents. Collaborate with IT and security teams to integrate security tools and processes into the CI/CD pipeline. Automation and scripting for automating various security task to reduce manual routine security operation and reduce likelihood of manual human error. Compliance and reporting for InfoSec KPI and security metrics. Create and maintain documentation for security automation processes and procedures. Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree (Computer Science, Information Systems) or equivalent applicable experience. Minimum 5 years working experience in related field. Preferably in a manufacturing environment. Well versed in programming language such as Python, C++, or similar. Experience in scripting languages such as PowerShell, PHP, Perl, or similar. Experience in REST API. Knowledge of DevOps/DevSecOps. Proficiency with automation tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, or similar. Good understanding in general IT/Cloud security and automation. Travel Required: None To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Dexcom. Only authorized staffing and recruiting agencies may use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes on specific requisitions. Dexcom does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to the Talent Acquisition team, Dexcom employees or any other company location. Dexcom is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.

Job Summary The Technical Cusotmer Engineer provides on-site technical support for customers to promote Nordson technology. The position entails assisting, troubleshooting, start-ups, and technical counseling on packaging division and preventative maintenance.Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities Provide on-site technical support to customers to promote Nordson technology. Support could be in the form of start-up service, maintenance, training or general technical counseling. Understanding of function capability for each component and communicate with customer, engineers or the technology department if questions exist. Perform the maintenance necessary to enable the customer to begin or continue their operation. This can include splitting and cleaning, replacing defective parts of the machine, adjust clearances, install and or assemble equipment. Responsible for preparing a toolbox with the correct set of tools and items necessary to perform their duties at the customer’s facility. Use various hand and power tools, hoists, dollies, rollers and trucks to complete the service call. Coordinate and schedule calls required at the customer's facility to accommodate the customers’ requirements. Summarize on a timely basis within one week of the visit the issues that were covered at the customer's facility in the form of a written service report. By doing so, this ensures documentation for future reference and gives guidance to our engineering department to provide corrective action where required. Provide technical support when telephone calls are received from customers. Support would include providing written instructions, verbal instructions or any communication needed to answer the customer. Consult with engineering and/or manufacturing as necessary to resolve a customer issue. Education and Experience Requirements Diploma degree Strong mechanical and electrical skills Demonstrated knowledge for field service for 0-5 years of experience Preferred Skills and Abilities Proven exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, to share technical knowledge with customer Must demonstrate the ability to read and interpret blueprints, diagrams, specifications and product manuals Excellent customer service skills Intermediate computer skills, including proficiency with Microsoft Office products Willingness to travel at a minimum of 75% of time Ability to learn new things quickly Self-motivated Travel Required 75% domestically

Overview: Hytech is a leading fintech company, committed to leveraging data to drive business insights and operational excellence. We are developing a scalable data lake using Databricks, designed to support high-volume, high-velocity, and high-variety data processing, enabling advanced analytics and machine learning. We are looking for a highly experienced Head of Data to lead our growing data team. Job Overview: As the Data Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing our data engineering, data analytics, and data architecture teams, ensuring the successful development and scalability of our data lake. You will drive the overall data strategy, fostering a culture of data excellence within a multinational team across different time zones. Your role will be pivotal in transforming raw data into actionable insights, enabling business leaders to make informed decisions. Key Responsibilities: Team Leadership & Management: Lead and manage a diverse, multinational team of data engineers, analysts, and architects, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous learning. Data Strategy & Governance: Develop and maintain a comprehensive data roadmap aligned with business objectives, prioritizing key data initiatives, governance, security, and compliance across multiple regions. Data Infrastructure & Architecture: Oversee the development and scalability of the company's data lake, ensuring a robust data pipeline and infrastructure. Collaboration & Stakeholder Management: Work closely with business leaders, product teams, and IT to ensure seamless data integration and utilization. Technology & Innovation: Stay abreast of emerging data technologies and trends, evaluating their 6, potential impact on Hytech's data strategy and innovation roadmap. Performance & Optimization: Establish KPIs and best practices for data quality, efficiency, and scalability. Qualifications & Experience: 8+ years of experience in data leadership roles, with a focus on data engineering, analytics, or data science. Strong expertise in data architecture, big data platforms, cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, or GCP), and data governance frameworks. Deep expertise in the Medallion Architecture, including its implementation and optimization for scalable data processing. Experience managing and scaling multinational teams across various regions. Proficiency in SQL, Python, Spark, and ETL tools. Strong understanding of business intelligence, data visualization, and analytics tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau). Excellent leadership, communication, and strategic planning skills. Prior experience in the financial services, fintech, or trading industry is a plus. Why Join Us? Opportunity to build and shape the company's data infrastructure from the ground up. Exciting opportunity to lead and drive machine learning initiatives that enhance business insights and operational efficiency. Work in a dynamic, multinational environment with exposure to global markets. We foster a collaborative and innovation-driven culture through cross-functional teams, hackathons, and continuous learning opportunities. If you are a data-driven leader passionate about building world-class data platforms in the fintech space encourage you to apply!

Job Duties: Lead and oversee the overall activities of data functions within the organization which include data science, acquisition, utilization and analysis. Lead the design and implementation in developing and enhancing the machine learning model for credit scoring that is highly scalable and compliant with BASEL II guidelines using advanced technical capabilities. Responsible for the production of a suite of complex data models depending on the business needs, leveraging a strong understanding of data modelling standards. Proactively work with various departments and business units to optimize the credit scoring models and data-driven decision-making by identifying and monitoring the data assets and analytics. Identifies what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources, leveraging new data collection processes and utilizing machine learning and data engineering to discover new data feeds with predictive power to derive borrower credit worthiness. Oversee the integration and use of external data sources to enhance scoring accuracy. Re-evaluate credit risk model performance on a periodic basis for retraining using statistics such as probability of default, confusion matrix, f1&f2 score, Lorenz Curve, Kolmogorov–Smirnov, GINI and AUC. Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements; automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc. Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics. Understand data sources, conduct data discovery, apply complex techniques to produce features for automation using a hypothesis driven approach Any other ad hoc task as assigned from time to time. Minimum Qualifications: Minimum Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science / Statistics / Information Systems / Actuarial Studies or equivalent, a Master’s Degree is will be an additional advantage. Minimum six (6) years of working experience is required for this position, candidates with experience in credit scoring will be prioritized. Experience in all or some of the following scripting languages: SQL, Python, R, SAS, Java, C++, SPSS, MATLAB. Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with Oracle DB. Experience in building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets will be an additional advantage. Strong project management and organizational skills, with experience in leading a team. *Our recruitment team will reach out to shortlisted candidates only.

About the Role: Join our dynamic team in Johor Bahru as an experienced Industrial Engineer! In this critical role, you'll optimize manufacturing processes, enhance production efficiency, and drive operational excellence in a fast-paced, Semiconductor Equipment manufacturing environment. Your expertise will help streamline workflows, reduce costs, and uphold the highest quality standards aligned with industry best practices. Work Location: Onsite - Johor Bahru Key Responsibilities: Process Optimization: Analyze and improve manufacturing processes, focusing on efficiency, cost reduction, and throughput. Develop and implement process improvements to enhance productivity, reduce cycle times, and ensure product quality. Layout and Workflow Design: Design and optimize plant layouts, workstations, and material flow to maximize space utilization, reduce waste, and enhance operational efficiency. Ensure smooth and safe workflow for both operators and equipment. Capacity Planning: Conduct capacity analysis and forecasting to ensure adequate resources are available to meet production demands. Optimize machine utilization and workforce allocation to balance supply and demand. Production Line Balancing: Identify areas for improvement in production line balancing and implement solutions to achieve optimal workforce and machine efficiency. Cost Analysis: Perform detailed cost analysis to identify areas of waste and recommend solutions for cost reduction, such as material optimization, labor efficiency, and process adjustments. Quality Control and Compliance: Ensure compliance with internal and external quality standards. Work with the quality assurance team to develop and implement procedures that meet SEMI industry standards and customer specifications. Data-Driven Decision Making: Use data analysis, including cycle time studies, labor analysis, and equipment performance data, to make informed decisions for continuous improvement. Project Management: Lead or support cross-functional projects aimed at improving production capabilities, process flows, and operational performance. Lean Manufacturing: Apply Lean principles and Six Sigma methodologies to reduce waste, improve process efficiency, and increase overall productivity. Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, production, logistics, and quality control, to solve complex manufacturing challenges and drive continuous improvement. Any other duties as assigned. Qualifications & Competencies: Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering or equivalent, with minimum 5+ years of relevant experience in a similar role, preferably in Semiconductor or Manufacturing industry. Proficient in simulating processes, materials, and manufacturing workflows, providing valuable input to engineers and management using recognized industrial tools. Strong analytical skills, with the ability to assess workforce utilization, layout efficiency, and operational data (e.g., production costs, process flow charts, production schedules) to optimize worker and equipment usage. Capable of recommending strategies for improving worker efficiency, reducing material waste, and optimizing resource usage through measures like job restructuring, workflow reorganization, workstation relocations, and equipment purchasing. Ability to confer effectively with management and engineering teams to implement proposed plans and improvements. Self-motivated, with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. Meticulous attention to detail, coupled with a strong commitment to delivering high-quality work. Familiarity with Lean Manufacturing or Six Sigma principles is a plus. Proficient in AutoCAD for layout planning; a passion for learning and developing expertise in AutoCAD is essential.

We are looking for an Associate Translation Specialist to join our Japanese content translation team in Clarivate Penang CoE, Malaysia. This role utilizes subject matter expertise in technical fields such as engineering, biomedical, life sciences, pharmaceutical & chemistry to perform machine translation post editing and proofreading of patent contents, translating patent inventor & assignee names as well as translating trademark applicant & agent names to ensure that the patent & trademark contents contain the most precise, pertinent, and up-to-date information. About You – experience, education, skills, and accomplishments Bachelor’s degree, preferably in STEM. Native level in Japanese (JLPT N1 or N2 certificate holder) as well as professional working proficiency in English. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Detail-oriented, thorough, accurate, able to meet deadlines, and able to work quickly and steadily in a focused manner to achieve organizational goals. Demonstrate initiative, persistence, ability to problem solve, and enthusiasm for learning. Strong ability to multitask, prioritize, and work independently with minimal supervision. It would be great if you also have... Academic or professional background in chemistry. Prior experience as a linguist using CAT tools. Prior experience in translation/content quality control. Background in intellectual property. Data analysis skills using Microsoft Excel, Power BI or other data analysis tools. Visible “can do” approach to work and positive attitude to change. A customer-driven approach and good business awareness. What will you be doing in this role? Review, edit, and evaluate machine translation output and language resources to optimize translation quality. Translate or perform machine translation post editing and proofreading of patent contents, mainly from Japanese into English. Conduct quality assurance checks for translation of assignee & inventor names of Japanese patent applications, and translation of applicant & agent names of Japanese trademark applications. Manage and maintain translation linguistic assets, including customer and industry-specific glossaries and translation memories, as well as create and update glossaries as needed in daily operations. Manage customer cases assigned by the customer service desk and operational requests for translation enhancement, allocate retranslation/enhancement requests and manage any associated updates to the master dictionaries and translation memory. Monitor translation quality within given deadlines, customer and subject area specificities, internal procedures and templates, quality standards, and KPIs. Participate in continuous improvement and corrective and preventive actions to reduce customer or internal complaints, improve efficiency, and mitigate risks. Participate in creating an inspiring team environment with an open communication culture and a team spirit. Undertake any other reasonable duties as requested by the team lead on a permanent or temporary basis. About the Team The translations teams in Penang, Malaysia mainly perform machine-assisted translations on patents from Japan/China/South Korea patent offices. The Japanese content translation team consists of 13 members reporting to the team lead, and we provide translations and contents for Clarivate’s key products such as Derwent Innovation, CompuMark & Cortellis. We support effective management and champion continuous improvement of our quality-driven operational workflow and practices, providing value-add insight and oversight of the names data like no others. Hours of Work This is a full-time permanent position with normal working hours (Monday – Friday, 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM). Out of working hour meetings may occur occasional to meet other teams from different time zones.

TechnipFMC is committed to driving real change in the energy industry. You’ll be joining a culture that values curiosity, expertise, and ideas as well as diversity, inclusion, and authenticity. Bring your unique energy to our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide, and discover a rewarding, fulfilling, and varied career that you can take in anywhere you want to go. Production Supervisor Job Purpose Involves in the supervision, leading and coordination of activities within the machine and clad shop environment to ensure that production and performance commitment are fulfilled. Trains, monitors and coaches team members to improve skill level, to ensure the team adheres to manufacturing policies and standards. Oversees the machine and clad shop responsibility for safety, quality, delivery and cost aspects. Promotes and practices on LEAN Manufacturing through implementation of Kaizen/Continuous Improvement activities. Conduct monitoring and control in the shop floor to ensure operators comply to manufacturing procedures. Familiarize and fully understand technical specification and relevant standards. Clarify and/or resolve any discrepancy with relevant parties. Responsible for inventory/transaction accuracy and adherence to department budget. Develops justification for headcount. Perform periodical reviews and provide inputs for procedure and/or process improvements, coordinate all aspect to the latest production technique, consumables controls, manufacturing parameters and requirements. Establishes employees’ objectives, coordinate and implement training internally and/or externally and carry out Reward and Disciplinary Action as required. Drives the team to meet manufacturing objectives in SQDC through LEAN and stabilized processes. Experience in Lean Manufacturing, Value Stream Flow, 5S, Visual Management and Problem-Solving Skills. Good communication and interpersonal skill. Strong PC skill in Microsoft office required SAP experience preferred. Being a global leader in the energy industry requires an inclusive and diverse environment.
