You will be a member of the Infra Operation & Cyber Security team reporting to the IT Server Ops Team Lead. Duties and Responsibilities: • Manage and perform administrative tasks on databases (Microsoft SQL, Oracle, MySQL) running on Windows & Linux platforms. • Monitoring the health of the databases, and perform trouble-shooting to identify and resolve any reported issues. • Install, configure and setup databases for application use. • Perform upgrade of databases and/or migration of databases from one product to another. • Perform database refresh across different environments. • Perform tuning and optimization activities to improve database performance and utilization of storage space. • Involve in the hardening of cloud databases like Azure SQL. • Monitor and manage data replication, including execution of database switchover for Disaster Recovery (DR) exercises. • Perform database maintenance, including applying and validating of security & critical patches. • Manage database security, and engage in process improvement such as automation of tasks and procedures. • Execute and provide technical support for the deployment of application fixes and/or changes in relation to the database. • Participate in system audits, adhere to the internal security standards. • Manage and co-ordinate with 3rd party vendors to troubleshoot and resolve problems. • Ensure availability and continuity of database services. • Involve in incident, problem, change and service request management. Requirements: • Diploma / Degree in Information Technology or equivalent with at least 5 years of experience in infrastructure support. • Minimum 5 years’ experience of MS SQL/MYSQL and Oracle DB Server. • Experience and understand with Azure Cloud, AAD, IAAS, PAAS, SAAS and etc. • Proficient in Database installation, configuration on Linux / Windows/Azure platforms. • Experience in Database High Availability setup using Oracle Dataguard, SQL Server Failover Replication/Mirroring Availability Groups, MySQL Cluster • Good database performance tuning, troubleshooting skills and locating bottlenecks at both server and database level. • Familiar with database partitioning design, Data warehouse, TDE encryption and implementing security standards to secure critical environments. • Disaster Recovery implementations based on Oracle Dataguard./SQL server /MYSQL Work with infrastructure team on upgrades, patching and resolution of cross functional issues. • Knowledge on SAP,CCNB,CRM,Oracle JDBC, ODP.Net, UCP, TAF, FCF, and MySQL Connectors. • Provide deployment support for database objects in production and UAT environments. • Provide 24x7 production database support and willing to work after office hours / weekends. About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. Why Join Us? Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Join us. About Trust & Safety Building a world where people can safely discover, create and connect. The Trust & Safety (T&S) team at TikTok helps ensure that our global online community is safe and empowered to create and enjoy content across all of our applications. We have invested heavily in human and machine-based moderation to remove harmful content quickly and often before it reaches our general community. About the Team The Search Operations team aims to improve search user experience, contribute significant DAU impact to the products and drive for increase in traffic and GMV. The Search Model Data Team is responsible for managing data labeling projects covering over 20 countries/regions and 18 languages. The data labeled will be provided to the R&D team, the R&D team will apply human labeled data to train and test algorithm models for various search business segments, helping to optimize the search engine, launch new features and improve user experience when using the search function on our platform. By thoroughly understanding the project background and model optimization direction as well as combining business experience and localized market characteristics, The Search Model Data Team is responsible for end-to-end project management throughout the entire project life cycle, including formulate project planning and labeling strategies/SOP, forecast resource and manpower, promote the implementation of labeling guidelines, and ensure the project delivery result. It is possible that this role will be exposed to harmful content as part of the core role/as part of project/ in response to escalation requests/by chance. This may occur in the form of images, video, and text related to every-day life, but it can also include (but is not limited to) bullying; hate speech; child safety; depictions of harm to self and others, and harm to animals. What will I be doing? Operation & Data Management - You will perform daily operational tasks including quality inspection, policy and process optimization, queue assignment and handling escalations of the labelling project. - You will work closely with respective project stakeholders and vendors to stay up to date with policy developments and provide feedback on implementation and execution. - You will be performing daily audit on internal system and provide analysis of errors and feedback to respective teams (R&D & Product Manager). - You will be monitoring the quality scored of agents and run root cause analysis to the management team. - You will be monitoring project data, record daily output and quality scores, prepare data analysis/report of projects as well as validate reports and data provided to stakeholders/partners. Training Management - You will be localizing the policy guidelines designing training schedule, coordinate and liaise with key stakeholders including BPO to ensure that all labellers successfully go-live within the targeted time frame. - You will deliver process/product/policy training in classroom and/or virtually to new joiners. - You will be involve in setting up product knowledge test, share result analysis and work with key stakeholders to improve the product knowledge of team. Qualifications What should I bring with me? - A minimum diploma & above education background. - You possess prior experience in a QA role, ideally within a Content Moderation / Content Quality / Safety environment. - You are familiar with search engines and algorithms of any social media platform or search engine optimization. - You come with experience in a BPO / call center / customer service or vendor management environment is a plus. - You have good attention to detail and you are comfortable using data analysis to identify trends. - Comfortable with and understand that the job requires reviewing internet content that may be deemed inappropriate and / or contain explicit materials - Your ability to work in a high tempo environment, adapt, respond to day-to-day challenges of the role. - Your resilience and commitment to self-care to manage the emotional demands of the role. Trust & Safety is committed to the wellbeing of all our employees. Our promise is to provide comprehensive and evidence-based programs, to promote and support physical and mental wellbeing throughout each employee's journey with us. We believe that wellbeing is a relationship and that everyone has a part to play, so we work in collaboration and consultation with our employees and across our functions in order to ensure a truly person-centred, innovative and integrated approach. TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Job Summary: Business Operation Data Governance will be the sole contact person between the data stewards and data management team in managing and overseeing the organization’s data assets to ensure data quality, integrity, and security. This role requires a strong analytical mindset to support data-driven decision-making processes within the insurance sector. Key Responsibilities: Data Governance: Establish and enforce data governance frameworks and best practices. Collaborate with stakeholders (e.g. data stewards and IT Data team) to ensure compliance with data governance policies by Prudential group, local and regulatory. (i.e.: compliance to DMMIS framework and Data Governance Risk and Compliance) Data Management: The sole contact point between the data stewards and the IT Data team in maintaining and managing data assets, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and completeness across all systems. Data Quality: The sole contact point between the data stewards and the IT Data team on alignment on data quality standards, policies, and procedures. Job Title: Chargeman - Data Centre (Network Facility Central Operation)
Job Responsibilities: Life at U Mobile We are Passionate, Innovative, Trustworthy, Team-Oriented & Fun-Loving. At U Mobile, we are always on the lookout for great talents and passionate individuals to join our growing team. Let’s start your journey with an award-winning organization! #UnbeatableCareerAwaits Top Reasons To Join Us! • Awarded For o Most Preferred Employers in Telecommunication Industry (2022, 2023 & 2024) o Bronze Winner in Cross-Generational Workforce Engagement (2024) o Gold Winner for Excellence in Workplace Culture (2021) • Comprehensive medical, dental, optical and insurance benefits • Flexi working hours arrangements • Staff Line & Device Subsidy • Smart Casual Attire • Child Parental Care Leave • Convenient location with access to public transport (Imbi Monorail/Bukit Bintang MRT) • Special employee discounts for selected F&B Brands Job Summary The LV Chargeman (Low Voltage) will oversee the operation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of LV electrical systems within Telecommunication Operating Centre (TOCs) on a rotating shift schedule. This role is essential to ensuring uninterrupted power supply and system functionality within TOCs and requires adherence to safety and regulatory standards in electrical operations. The Day-To-Day Activities Perform routine checks, maintenance, and testing on all LV electrical equipment, including switchboards, circuit breakers, lighting, power distribution units (PDUs), and uninterruptible power supply (UPS) systems. Conduct inspections at the start and end of each shift to ensure optimal functionality of critical electrical components. Diagnose and resolve electrical faults or malfunctions swiftly to avoid operational disruptions during each shift. Respond to emergency breakdowns and outages during shifts, coordinating with other team members to restore power and services promptly. Implement scheduled preventive maintenance activities to enhance the reliability and efficiency of TOC electrical systems. Record corrective actions and ensure issues are followed up across shifts for continued system stability. Maintain accurate shift logs, detailing maintenance activities, repairs, system status, and any issues requiring follow-up. Conduct thorough handover briefings to incoming shift personnel, ensuring seamless continuity in operations and addressing any outstanding tasks. Adhere to all safety protocols and regulatory standards, including lockout/tagout procedures, to protect personnel and equipment. Ensure compliance with the local electrical code and conduct safety checks on systems and components regularly. About You • Certification: Must hold a valid Chargeman certification, minimum AO grade, issued by Suruhanjaya Tenaga (Energy Commission of Malaysia). • Experience: At least 3 years of experience in electrical maintenance within critical facilities or telecommunications environments. • Technical Knowledge: Proficient in LV electrical systems, Rectifier systems, UPS systems, power distribution units, and emergency power procedures. What’s Next ? Once you have applied online, our team will review your application and due to a high volume of applications, only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is growing rapidly, and we are looking for Data Center Technician to join our expanding Infrastructure Operations team. Data Center Operations designs, installs and maintains the world’s largest Computing Infrastructure. Our scope of work includes systems, repairing, dealing with issues, handling and tracking parts and assisting in Data Center maintenance. Amazon Data Centers are large-scale high-density centers where you will help change the face of Technology in the region. Key job responsibilities In this role as a Data Center Operations Technician, you will be responsible for the on-site management of hardware lifecycle of our IT infrastructure that includes: - You will troubleshoot technical issues on advanced hardware, ranging from servers, storage and networking devices so they operate on a 24/7 basis. - You will maintain a high level of system reliability and availability. - You will participate in projects to enhance operational efficiencies with opportunities to share experiences and knowledge with our global network of technical experts. - You will share knowledge and help train less technical staff on the best practices related to all service owner issues. - You will contribute towards building a great team by getting involved in the Amazon hiring process/candidate interviews. - You will work and meet SLAs against assigned trouble tickets via a directed workflow, be the first line touch point for hardware troubleshooting and technical issues. - You will perform on-call duties and will participate in Data Center operations, handling scheduled maintenance and change management activities that require monitoring of the data center infrastructure. - You will participate in team meetings for metric analysis and to discuss achieving daily/weekly goals. - You have the knowledge of the policies and procedures, including safety and security, within your department, and understand the appropriate application of such knowledge - You will contribute to documentation on technical issues through root cause analysis for operational issues that occur, and contribute to process improvement initiatives relevant to the data center environment. - More experienced technicians may assist in training less experienced members of the team. A day in the life - You will support DC (Data Center) infrastructure equipment (e.g. racks, servers, networking devices, hardware components, cables, etc.), - You will follow the instructions ticket-based environment and work on systematic problem resolution and perform routine operation activities on hardware, or spare parts, including rack install, server break/fix, rack decom etc. - You will perform on-call duties and will participate in Data Center operations, handling scheduled maintenance and change management activities that require monitoring of the data center infrastructure. - Show a strong aptitude for troubleshooting and problem solving - You will be involved with site management and maintain tidiness in operation areas - Your role involves covering 24x7 shift rotation BASIC QUALIFICATIONS - 5+ years of Server Hardware and network fiber hands-on experiences required. - Experience in Network troubleshooting, Optical Fiber Cabling, Switches and Routers. - Comfortable acting as escalation and strong communication skills. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS - Linux certification and/or administration experience - RHCSA/RHCE, LPIC, Linux+ - Networking certification - CCENT/CCNA, Network+ - Scripting skills – e.g., Python, Ruby, Perl, Bash - Server+, A+, CompTIA

Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter Diagnostics? Take a closer look. At first glance, you’ll see that for more than 80 years we’ve been dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and healthcare forward. Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. We’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. Look again and you’ll see we are invested in you, providing the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and try new things with the support you need to be successful. Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges. The Commercial Operations Analyst, APAC for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is responsible for transforming raw data into meaningful insights that drive decision-making and strategic planning. You will work closely with various departments to understand their data needs and provide analytical solutions that enhance business performance and operational efficiency. This position is part of the Beckman Coulter APAC commercial operations located in Malaysia/Thailand/India. At Beckman Coulter, our vision is to relentlessly reimagine healthcare, one diagnosis at a time. You will be a part of the Beckman Coulter APAC team and report to the Commercial Operations Director, APAC responsible for commercial operations oversight throughout the APAC region. If you thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced and supporting role and want to work to build a world-class commercial organization—read on. In this role, you will have the opportunity to: Become a subject matter expert in APAC data by learning and understanding the business, sourcing accurate data and developing both prescriptive and predictive analytics to help identify and resolve business challenges. JOB SUMMARY The candidate will focus on implementing, maintaining, and supporting the Beacon Mart Group of Companies' applications and systems. The role includes optimizing system usage to enhance operational efficiency and ensuring the fulfilment of infrastructure requirements in collaboration with the IT department. The candidate will also be involved in ERP system implementation, data management, and process improvement initiatives. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES APPLICATION IMPLEMENTATION AND MAINTENANCE Collaborate with the IT department to ensure infrastructure requirements for applications are met and aligned with organizational standards. Implement and maintain business applications, including POS systems, in-house software, and third-party solutions. Gather requirements from various departments and customize applications to meet operational needs. Perform troubleshooting, resolve application-related issues promptly, and manage system updates and patches. Create and maintain master data based on agreed processes and ensure consistency across systems. Develop and maintain documentation, including user guides, training materials, and troubleshooting manuals. Liaise with vendors and service providers to manage application upgrades and enhancements. 2. SYSTEM OPTIMIZATION AND PROCESS IMPROVEMENT Analyse current processes and propose improvements based on system capabilities to maximize operational efficiency. Suggest logical, system-driven solutions to enhance workflows and reduce inefficiencies. Identify opportunities to automate tasks and streamline processes using application features. Train and support end-users to ensure they utilize applications effectively. 3. ERP SYSTEM IMPLEMENTATION Work closely with cross-functional teams to map business processes and configure ERP modules accordingly. Support data migration activities, ensuring data accuracy and consistency during transitions. Test and validate ERP modules to ensure they meet operational requirements and user expectations. Provide end-user training and post-implementation support to ensure smooth adoption and usage of the ERP system. Document ERP workflows, configurations, and related procedures for future reference. 4. DATA MANAGEMENT AND REPORTING Extract, process, and analyse data from various systems, including POS, ERP, and in-house applications. Create and maintain dashboards and reports using tools like Excel, Power BI, or Tableau to provide actionable insights. Support departments in defining and monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs). Ensure the accuracy, integrity, and timeliness of data used for decision-making. 5. COLLABORATION AND OPERATIONAL FAMILIARIZATION Collaborate with operational teams across the group to understand different companies’ processes and working relationships. Build a deep understanding of the group’s diverse operations, ensuring effective communication and alignment between systems and business needs. Act as a bridge between technical teams and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring clarity in project objectives and deliverables. 6. DATA SECURITY AND COMPLIANCE Monitor and enforce IT security protocols for applications, ensuring data integrity, confidentiality, and compliance with organizational standards. Regularly back up critical data and assist in disaster recovery planning. JOB REQUIREMENTS: Good working attitude Degree or Diploma in IT, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field. Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply. Prior experience in application implementation or support is an advantage but not mandatory. Willing to travel TECHNICAL SKILLS: Proficiency in business applications, including POS systems and reporting tools. Familiarity with SQL and database management is highly desirable. Knowledge of tools like Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms. SOFT SKILLS: Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and under pressure in high-stress environments. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent time management to meet tight deadlines and prioritize tasks effectively. Exceptional communication skills for interacting with technical and non-technical stakeholders. Ability to explain technical concepts clearly to end-users. Positive attitude, eagerness to learn, and a collaborative approach to teamwork. JOB PERKS Hands-on involvement in diverse application and MIS projects, with opportunities to grow professionally. Exposure to innovative technologies, including ERP systems. Collaborative work environment with a dynamic team.

Sector: Data Entry & Word Processing (Administration & Office Support)
Job Responsibilities: Job Description 1. Review the contract draft in accordance with the trader’s specifications and requirements. 2. Ensure timely completion of payment and arrange delivery of goods as per the terms outlined in the contract draft. 3. Coordinate with the company's quality inspection personnel or entrust an inspection company to arrange quality inspection. 4. Compile quality data and report to the trader and operations manager. 5. Keep track of pricing periods and futures hedging records, and updating relevant documentation accordingly. 6. Issue settlements and verify customer settlement documents. 7. Prepare customs declaration documents and arrange for export clearance. 8. Coordinate with freight forwarder to ensure smooth and efficient shipment. Job Requirement Candidate must possess at least Diploma in any discipline. Required language(s): English, Bahasa Malaysia. Proficiency in Mandarin is a plus as this role requires liaising with Mandarin speaking suppliers and colleagues to complete daily tasks. Computer literate with knowledge in Microsoft Excel and Word. Detailed oriented, can work with minimal supervision Must be willing to work in Kuala Lumpur. Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply. What we offer At Grand Tai Sdn. Bhd., we are committed to providing a supportive and rewarding work environment for our employees. Some of the key benefits you can expect include: - Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses - Ongoing training and oversea work-exchange opportunities - Opportunities for career advancement within the company - Social and team-building activities to foster a positive work culture About us Grand Tai Sdn. Bhd. is a leading provider of business solutions and services in Malaysia. Grand Tai Merchants (Shanghai) Co., Ltd . was established in 2005. It is headquartered at the CBD in Lujiazui Shanghai and set up a number of companies in the United States, Singapore, Malaysia, and the Middle East. Grandtai Focuses on and deeply rooted the metal mineral industry chain, it has become a comprehensive service company in integrating international trade, international logistics, international financial services, and international production and manufacturing. It has established a good cooperative relationship, especially in the field of non-ferrous minerals such as copper concentrates and lead zinc concentrates, and has its own characteristic positioning and professional advantages, and enjoys a high reputation globally. In 2023, the Group's turnover was nearly 10 billion RMB, with a profit and tax of tens of millions of RMB.

Responsibilities TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. Why Join Us Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Join us. About the Team : As the Operations Data Team Lead, you will lead a team of CoreOps Data Specialists to support our Core Ops and Vendor Ops teams. Your role is pivotal in providing strategic direction, overseeing data analysis initiatives, and ensuring the delivery of accurate and actionable insights to support operational decision-making. You will collaborate closely with leadership, stakeholders, and the data team to drive efficiencies, develop robust reporting mechanisms, and continuously improve operational processes through data-driven insights. Responsibilities : Lead and mentor a team of CoreOps Data Specialists, providing guidance, coaching, and professional development opportunities. Develop and implement data analysis strategies to measure, monitor, and optimize core operational KPIs in alignment with organizational goals. Collaborate with Operations and Vendor Ops teams to understand their data and analytics needs, translating requirements into actionable projects for the data specialists. Oversee the design, development, and maintenance of databases, ensuring data accuracy, integrity, and accessibility for the team. Drive the creation of interactive dashboards and reports, utilizing data visualization tools to present insights in a clear and compelling manner. Partner with BI, Data Science, and IT teams to streamline data collection processes, access relevant datasets, and leverage advanced analytics techniques. Continuously evaluate and improve internal systems for data processing, cleansing, and storage, implementing best practices and protocols. Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for operational optimization through in-depth analysis of complex datasets. Serve as a liaison between the data team and operational stakeholders, ensuring effective communication and understanding of data-driven insights. Keep abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analytics, applying knowledge to enhance team capabilities and methodologies. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications : Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis, with at least 5 years in a leadership or managerial role. Proven track record of leading data teams to deliver impactful insights and solutions in a fast-paced environment. Preferred Qualifications : Expertise in database design, data modeling, and SQL; familiarity with tools such as Excel, Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Strong analytical mindset with the ability to translate complex data into actionable recommendations for operational improvements. Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively across cross-functional teams and levels of the organization. Demonstrated leadership qualities, including mentorship, team building, and project management skills. Experience in the technology operations, online services, or related industry preferred. TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Summary of Role We are looking for a Data & Digital Media - Operations Associate to work closely with internal teams to improve and manage internal operational and sales processes. This is a full time role based in Kuala Lumpur working with teams across the APAC region. We are looking for an organised and analytical individual who will be responsible for providing support across financial, administrative, sales and delivery processes. You will work closely with both the Data & Digital Media Professional Services and Project Management Teams across the APAC region. The role will be varied in nature and require the person to lead administrative initiatives in CRM, finance, project management and other systems. This will include working with senior team members to perform maintenance tasks in various platforms and adhere to and improve monthly project processes. This role reports into an Operations Manager based in Australia. The Role Responsibilities will include working under the direction of management to: Assist on new process implementation for the organization by working in a support and administrative function for the team. Troubleshoot errors related to administrative processes in key internal platforms, communicate with teams on fix processes. Assist on new process implementation for the organization by working in a support and administrative function for the team. Understand basic financial processes and principles in order to assist with administrative tasks. Update internal Knowledge Base systems with supplied content. Perform reporting (analysis & insights) on project operations. Perform regular audits and deep dives into project data, providing recommendations for process improvement Communicate with team members on submission of key documents & update CRM system on a monthly basis. Audit and report on system usage best practices, communicating with team members when processes are not followed. Provide adherence reports to senior management to define improvement rates. Create and manage basic contracting templates. Requirements Experience working in a similar administrative support role for 2+ years Exposure to business platforms (CRM, Project Management, financial systems or similar) Excellent verbal and interpersonal communication skills Strong English language skills Exposure to any of these systems is a plus, but not a requirement: Salesforce Sales Cloud or any other CRM system Microsoft .xlsx, Google Sheets any other spreadsheet program Jira or any other project management tooling Experience in creating reports, completing basic data analysis and interpretation. Ability to create and manage adherence processes. Ability to communicate processes with team members and elicit change from team members. Basic understanding of financial processes. Responsible, self-motivated, use initiative, results-oriented. This will be key as the role involves working with global teams in different timezones. Happy to work autonomously and the willingness to take specific direction on occasion as well. #LI-CX1 About Media.Monks Media.Monks is the purely digital, unitary operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 7,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Joining Media.Monks means becoming part of a highly ambitious collective of some of the most gifted, focused, joyful talent from all over the world, with the goal to change the industry for good. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-23), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, and continual inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-24). In addition, we’ve received the honor of being Adweek’s first AI Agency of the year (2023), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-24), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth. We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us. While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process. We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Production Admin cum Data Statistician to support our production operations and analyze data for process improvement. This role combines administrative responsibilities with statistical analysis to ensure efficient production workflows and data-driven decision-making. Administrative Duties: Manage inventory records and work orders for production. Prepare reports, presentations, and documentation related to production activities. Coordinate with various department to streamline production processes. Maintain and update production-related databases and records. Assist in handling production-related inquiries and communication. Data & Statistical Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret production data to identify trends and improvement opportunities. Develop reports and dashboards to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs). Utilize statistical tools and software for data analysis. Identify inefficiencies in production processes using data-driven insights. Provide recommendations based on data analysis to optimize productivity and reduce costs. Support decision-making through forecasting and predictive modeling. Requirements : Minimum Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business Administration, Industrial Engineering, or a related field. Proven experience in administrative and data/statistical analysis roles (preferably in a manufacturing or production environment). Proficiency in MS Excel, data visualization tools and statistical software. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities. Good communication and collaboration skills.

Job Title: Data Center Customer Operations Engineer IV
Job Responsibilities: Who are we? Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company®, operating over 260 data centers across the globe. Digital leaders harness Equinix's trusted platform to bring together and interconnect foundational infrastructure at software speed. Equinix enables organizations to access all the right places, partners and possibilities to scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences and multiply their value, while supporting their sustainability goals. Joining our operations team means that you will be at the forefront of all we do, maintaining critical facilities infrastructure as part of a close-knit team delivering best-in-class service to our data center customers. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success. Data Center Customer Operations Engineer IV Job Summary The Data Center Customer Operations Engineer is responsible for the prioritization, fulfillment, and quality assurance of time-bound ticket-driven requests within the Data Center, including Expedite/Negotiate, Trouble tickets, Smart-hands, Installation/De-installation of Cages/Cabinets/Cabling, Custom Orders, Tape backups, Escorts services, Network Support, Logistics Support and Security Support. Responsibilities Queue Management / Reporting Reviews work order requests in the queue and responds to semi-routine work orders by adhering to commitment times Escalates and expedites orders to appropriate teams upon standard operating procedures; supervision is needed on escalating non-standard procedure escalation requests Ensures adherence to commit times within standard operating procedures Maintains detailed written records of all work activity Updates local asset databases and other systems Installations Supports intra-cage infrastructure installations by following the standard operating procedures of semi-routine customer installs, which may include: fiber trays, ladder racks, customer equipment, and cabinets Cage installs for mesh and overhead cable trays; and performs tape changes and standard operating back-up changes Cross-Connect Supports data center standard operating cross-connect work order requests for installation, terminations, and modifications Ensures the standard operating procedures are followed on cable management of coaxial, fiber, twisted pair copper, and semi-routine intra-building cross-connects Install basic connect circuits (switched, multiplexed, etc.), under supervision Testing / Troubleshooting Supports standard operating testing and standard operating installations of customer assets Supports standard operating procedures of layer 1 cross-connect certification testing May perform standard operating layer 2 and layer 3 testing, under supervision Stakeholder Partnership Supports the operations and security personnel team for breaks or other activities, when necessary Supports standard operating procedural tasks Provide backup assistance to team members when necessary Customer Management Supports customer satisfaction with timely adherence to following semi-routine execution order requirements Delivers a high level of service and an excellent customer experience when interfacing with customers Ensure time expectations on new deployments and existing alterations, by following standard operating procedure guidelines Supports customers on-site through access control and escorting services Projects Supports fulfillment of projects that follow standard operating procedures; if projects deviate from standard procedures, then works under supervision Supports vendors on projects Supports physical customer audits Training Completes all assigned training promptly May provide support to new hires Incident Management Assists more senior staff with responding to all on-site incidents and acts as directed Collaboration May work internally or with other departments to support and increase efficiencies and reduce potential failure scenarios Qualifications Typically requires a high school diploma or degree and 3+ years of equivalent work experience Ability to safely and effectively perform the necessary physical tasks associated with the job Equinix is committed to ensuring that our employment process is open to all individuals, including those with a disability. If you are a qualified candidate and need assistance or an accommodation, please let us know by completing this form. Equinix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and, in the U.S., an Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to unlawful consideration of race, color, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, sex, pregnancy / childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic partnership status, age, veteran or military status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, political / organizational affiliation, status as a victim or family member of a victim of crime or abuse, or any other status protected by applicable law.

Job Title: Client Operations Officer, Master Data Services (Pricing) M/F

CACEIS Malaysia has been a cornerstone of asset servicing since 2008, evolving into a trusted hub of operational excellence within the global CACEIS network. Strategically located in IOI City, Putrajaya, the company employs over 1,200 skilled professionals, providing a broad spectrum of services to institutional clients across Europe. Job Responsibilities: Hi, we’re Actabl. Are you excited about a career in SaaS that has a direct effect on the hospitality industry? This might be the perfect opportunity for you! Our mission is to empower the people that power hospitality. We’re on a journey to provide better solutions for hotel companies as the world around us evolves and changes related to using technology, finding labor, and maximizing profits. We give hoteliers actionable insights to know what to do, the tools to do it, and the visibility to know it worked. We bring together powerful hospitality tech solutions to maximize profits for more than 10,000 properties in hospitality markets around the world. Our Valued Behaviors Start with People: We are in the hospitality business and hospitality starts with people. This impacts both our being and our doing. Being: We are responsible for building relationships, earning trust, and having fun. These things are fundamental to hospitality. Doing: We will succeed if we start with great people working as one team. Empower others, speak the truth with care, and go together. Demand Integrity: Be trustworthy, be ethical, and be consistent whether someone is watching or not. Demand integrity of yourself and others to build the fabric of a high-integrity organization. Delight the Customer: We aim to delight our customers in the same way our customers aim to delight their guests. The question is not if completed a process or hit a metric, the question is whether or not the customer is delighted. Champion Innovation: We compete in the game of change and win through innovation. Think big and then think bigger when it comes to the innovation required to tackle the problems our customers face daily. Make it Happen: We show up prepared, care about the details, and follow through. Don't get distracted. Don't stop at blockers. Don't make excuses. Find a way and drive until it is done. Your Role - Come Join Our Team! Position Summary: The Director of Data Governance will be responsible for developing and implementing a data governance strategy and framework that promotes a data-driven culture while ensuring data quality, integrity, and security. Collaborating closely with multiple departments, the Director will establish and maintain data governance policies, standards, and practices that align with and support business objectives. Essential Duties: Data Governance Leadership: Develop and implement a comprehensive data governance strategy and framework Evaluate the organization's data governance needs and propose a suitable organizational structure Assess the current data governance tool and recommend whether to retain or replace it. Establish data governance policies, standards, and procedures to ensure data quality, integrity, and security Establish & lead the Data Governance Committee and collaborate with stakeholders to drive data governance initiatives Monitor compliance with data governance policies and address any issues or gaps Data Quality and Integrity: Define and enforce data quality standards and metrics Implement data quality management processes to ensure accurate and reliable data Conduct regular data quality assessments and audits Work with data stewards to resolve data quality issues and improve data accuracy Data Security and Privacy: Develop and enforce data security and privacy policies in compliance with regulatory requirements Ensure data protection measures are in place to safeguard sensitive information Collaborate with IT and legal teams to address data security and privacy concerns Monitor and respond to data breaches or security incidents Collaboration and Communication: Foster a data-driven culture by promoting the importance of data governance across the organization Provide training and support to employees on data governance policies and best practices Communicate data governance goals, progress, and outcomes to senior leadership and stakeholders Collaborate with IT, legal, compliance, and business units to align data governance efforts with business objectives Minimum Qualifications: Proven experience in data governance, data management, or a related field (8+ years) Strong understanding of data governance frameworks, policies, and best practices Experience with data quality management, data security, and privacy regulations Knowledge of data management tools and technologies Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills x`Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and influence stakeholders Key Competencies: Develop and Implement Data Governance Framework: Experience in Data Governance: Proven track record of developing and implementing data governance strategies and frameworks. Policy Development: Ability to create and enforce data governance policies, standards, and procedures. Stakeholder Collaboration: Strong skills in collaborating with stakeholders to ensure alignment with organizational objectives. Attention to Detail: Meticulous in ensuring data quality, integrity, and security. Project Management: Ability to manage projects effectively and meet deadlines. 2. Evaluate and Optimize Data Governance Tools: Technical Expertise: In-depth knowledge of data governance tools and technologies. Analytical Skills: Ability to assess and evaluate the effectiveness of current tools. Decision-Making: Strong decision-making skills to recommend whether to retain or replace tools. Implementation Skills: Experience in successfully implementing new tools or enhancing existing ones. Problem-Solving: Proactive approach to identifying and addressing tool-related issues. 3. Design and Propose Data Governance Organizational Structure: Organizational Design: Experience in evaluating and designing organizational structures. Strategic Thinking: Ability to align the organizational structure with data governance needs and business objectives. Presentation Skills: Strong skills in developing and presenting proposals to senior leadership. Leadership: Ability to gain approval and lead the implementation of the proposed structure. Change Management: Experience in managing change and driving organizational improvements. 4. Enhance Data Quality and Security: Data Quality Management: Expertise in defining and enforcing data quality standards and metrics. Audit and Assessment: Experience in conducting data quality assessments and audits. Regulatory Compliance: Knowledge of data security and privacy regulations and ability to ensure compliance. Crisis Management: Ability to respond effectively to data breaches or security incidents. Training and Communication: Skills in training employees on data governance policies and best practices. Work Environment: May require travel

The Technical Operations Executive is responsible for making sense of data from various sources. This can be achieved by developing and maintaining automated reporting and data management processes and dashboard to track and communicate financial, operations data and KPIs with various stakeholders. The role works closely with the Banking Operations, Compliance, Investment, Business Intelligence teams and Data Engineers to define and achieve report/ data goals. The Technical Operations Executive is expected to be analytical, attentive to details and continuously identifying opportunities for improvement while keeping a keen eye on the big picture. He/she grasps complex topics quickly and is adept at thinking on their feet to solve problems in a creative and holistic manner. Daily Responsibilities: Develop and maintain reports / dashboards which communicate financial and operational data and KPIs. Collect and interpret financial and operational data from various sources. Collaborating with stakeholders from various departments to define report/ data goals and data engineers to set up data pipelines for data extraction. Develop and maintain departmental documentation, including report/dashboard specifications. Participate in project planning, execution, monitoring, and providing status updates to stakeholders. Other Responsibilities: In between reporting and data projects, participate in process improvement projects as a Stakeholder of Operations Team. Assist the regional Operations team in daily BAU tasks including processing daily deposits and withdrawals and monitoring reconciliations. This is important for the executive to be up to date with the latest processes and domain knowledge. Assist the regional Operations team in resolving transactional issues leveraging data (e.g. stalled withdrawals, reconciliation discrepancies) together with the Tech team. Requirements Prior experience of 1 – 2 years of experience in writing SQL scripts and queries is required. Experience within fintech or startups or financial services spaces will be a plus point. Knowledge in Excel Macro, GSheet App Script, data dashboard creation, and other programming languages will be a plus point. Good analytical, statistical, business analysis and problem-solving skills. Able to quickly comprehend data architecture, business data and business requirements, and produce reports and dashboards to improve business efficiency. Good communication skills and attitude. Able to comprehend and communicate using basic English language skills. Expected to interact with stakeholders from various departments on a regional level regularly. Being well-organized, adaptable, and paying great attention to detail is of utmost importance. Given the daily introduction of new challenges, we are looking for someone with the intelligence and determination to tackle and adjust to changes. We value practical skills and a passion for data. Recent graduates and individuals with experience gained through self-study or coding bootcamps are welcome to apply. Benefits Employee financial and physical well-being Compensation package: You will receive a competitive total compensation package that includes employee stock options if you are a full-time employee. Comprehensive insurance coverage: Free panel outpatient GP clinic visits, group hospitalisation and surgical insurance, and Covid hospitalisation insurance coverage (conditions apply). Management fee discount: You will receive an employee discount on your asset management fees when you invest with StashAway. Flexible work arrangements and policies Unlimited paid annual leave: It should be simple for you to decide if you would like to take more or fewer days off. We trust that you are accountable for your work and know best if you need 10 or 30 days of paid annual leave that year. Personal work equipment budget: It’s important that you have a workstation that’s optimal for you wherever you are. Learning and development opportunities You will be given an annual Learning and Development budget to help you continuously learn in your pursuit of your professional and personal development. You may use the budget for resources and tools that may help you perform better at work. This budget is subject to management approval. Team bonding budget and initiatives Quarterly team bonding budget: We encourage you to socialise with colleagues across job functions, departments, and entities to know them better as individuals beyond what they professionally do. Annual off-site (Nov): Each off-site gathers all employees for a full day of company-wide team bonding activities and challenges.

This role requires a deep understanding of operational metrics to drive efficiency and performance. Order and Revenue Forecasting: Identify potential delays and risks in progress, analyze underlying issues, and propose proactive solutions. Conduct regular reviews to expose risks, ensuring continuous improvement in forecasting accuracy and operational success. PPL Management: Optimize the management of PPL based on order and revenue forecasts. Focus on modules with slow progress or negative YoY growth by conducting thorough reviews and providing high-quality support to drive performance improvements. 2. Operational Excellence and Efficiency Play a key role in improving organizational efficiency by implementing strategies that streamline operations and enhance team productivity. Ensure smooth management of key tasks and drive business objectives forward. Improving Operational Efficiency: Develop and execute detailed plans that align with the department’s goals. Regularly review plans with supervisors to track progress, identify risks, and ensure successful outcomes. Conduct in-depth risk assessments and provide actionable next steps to mitigate challenges. Management of Key Departmental Tasks: Lead the management and progress of high-priority tasks within the department. Focus on identifying and addressing issues early, ensuring continuous progress towards achieving departmental goals. Closed-Loop Task Management: Ensure that outstanding tasks are handled in a structured, efficient manner, helping to address key operational issues and significantly improve team performance and efficiency. Organizing Departmental Meetings: Coordinate regular department meetings to review progress, uncover potential risks, and facilitate timely resolution of business challenges. Ensure comprehensive meeting documentation and follow-through. 3. Labor Hours and Expertise Management Assist in managing the department’s labor hours and expertise, ensuring optimal resource allocation. Play a pivotal role in supporting the Solution Performance Committee’s initiatives and goals. Comprehensive understanding of the solutions business within the enterprise ICT industry. Team player, self-motivated, result-oriented, and able to work independently with minimal supervision. Knowledge of the ICT environment, strategic partnerships for solutions, and industry/business trends, enabling effective solution development, is an advantage. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively with mid to senior-level clients and internal teams across different geographies and cultures. Previous experience as an Operations Engineer or Specialist is considered a plus. Willingness to travel for business within the Asia Pacific region. What we hope you're good with Exceptional Communication and Teamwork Skills: Proven ability to articulate ideas clearly and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Strong interpersonal skills are essential for fostering a cooperative work environment. Goal-Oriented Process Management: Demonstrated ability to drive results, manage complex workflows, and ensure team alignment with business objectives. Proficiency in Data Analysis: Strong analytical skills, with advanced proficiency in Excel and other data analysis tools to track performance, generate insights, and support decision-making. Multitasking and Time Management: Ability to juggle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment, while maintaining attention to detail and meeting deadlines. What we offer We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, and opportunities for professional development and career growth. Our dynamic and inclusive work environment encourages innovation and collaboration, allowing you to make a meaningful impact on the future of telecommunications.

The position reports to the Chief Operations Officer Job Overview: We are seeking a Process Governance Senior Specialist who will play a key role in delivering our department's mandate and the business division's ambitions. As the specialist, you will be responsible for managing, supporting, guiding, mentoring, and ensuring the timely and efficient delivery output of various streams including Customer Service, Technology, Product, Billing, Finance, Sales and Customer Management as well as within Retail Operations. You will have end-to-end accountability to achieve agreed benchmarks and compliance standards set forth by the company, division, and department. Responsibilities: Act as a problem solver with a strong understanding of the importance of providing the best customer experience. You should be result-oriented, process-driven, and committed to delivering best-in-class quality with quick and effortless service delivery through active engagement with all counterparts. Collaborate with teams across the organization to ideate, align and document and processes in key areas across functions, including analysing change impact. Identify, drive and deliver business process improvements that streamline activities, ensure robustness and compliance, increase quality and efficiency, and represent best practices, involving Change Management activities, such as training and communicating changes Be responsive to all tasks and matters directed to you through various communication channels (emails, calls, SMS, WhatsApp, Zoom, etc.). Provide immediate attention to sort, resolve, address, and close matters/tasks with quality and urgency based on business requirements. Contribute to the organization's value creation and exemplify TIME leadership expectations, including being passionate about the business, encouraging change and continuous improvement, ensuring excellent execution, maintaining integrity and accountability, being curious and engaging with teams, being decisive and action-oriented, being courageous and innovative, and being resourceful and results-oriented. Your work life: Accountable and well versed in the Organisation’s processes and procedures. Map and assess processes and ways of working across the key functions in Operations. Identify process improvements, redesign processes using lean principles, and ensure compliance with best practices, regulatory standards. Develop and implement process controls, monitoring, optimization, and continuous improvement tools. Highly involved in product briefing, PPV and UAT activities to support system/product/promotion launches. Collaborate with operations teams to consolidate operational processes and system user requirements. Produce and track users’ requirements specification (URS), work closely with IT PMO on URS status and timeline, conduct testing, and monitor stability periods. Analyze operational data, and turn into insight and action plans. Produce KPI, performance related reporting with action plans to improve to management. Perform other tasks assigned by management. To be considered, you’ll need: Bachelor's degree in Finance, Telecommunications, Business Management, Information Systems, or Engineering 5 years of working experience in a relevant role. Technology expertise, Lean Six Sigma, Business Process Improvement (BPI), CMMI, and Microsoft Visio skills would be an added advantage. Strong attention to detail and understanding of processes and systems. Comfortable with intense operational work and highly customer-oriented. Proactive with initiative and a creative problem-solving mindset. Ability to multitask, prioritize assignments, and manage time effectively. Excellent communication skills at all levels. Customer-focused mindset and ability to anticipate and mitigate problems. Take-lead mentality and commitment to delivering on the mandate. What you get: Cool and innovative work environment Work-life balance and our working hours are flexible We are too cool for ties. Smart casual is our game! We care about you and your family’s health and wellbeing Learning and growth opportunity We have an indoor slide and a cafe! How fun is that?! Free car park within the company compound *Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. So, make your CV as fun and interesting as possible!

Job Responsibilities: The Assistant Shift Lead will play a critical role in ensuring the smooth and efficient execution of batch processing tasks within our data center environment. This position involves monitoring, controlling, and maintaining batch processing systems, performing routine checks, addressing technical issues, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure the timely delivery of processed data to our clients. • Proven experience as a Data Center Operator or similar role, with specific exposure to batch processing operations. • Familiarity with batch processing tools, such as A-Auto (Mainframe tool), ASG ZENA scheduler (to monitor FTP & Batches) or similar. • Proficiency in working with mainframe systems and open systems. • Knowledge of IT infrastructure components, including servers (VMWare), storage systems (Veritas NetBackup monitoring), and to use putty for Unix related tasks. To work on a rotating shift schedule (2 shift cycle/ 12 hours shift), including weekends and holidays, to ensure 24/7 coverage of batch processing operations. Coordinate and delegate tasks among team members to ensure smooth operation during day-end processing. • Supervise the execution of day-end processing procedures, ensuring accuracy and timeliness in data handling, backups, and other critical tasks. • Address any issues or challenges that arise during day-end processing promptly and effectively, either by resolving them directly or escalating them to appropriate personnel. • Monitor system performance and data integrity throughout the day-end processing period and generate reports detailing any anomalies or discrepancies for further investigation. • Manage resources such as personnel, equipment, and supplies effectively to optimize workflow and ensure the successful completion of day-end processing tasks. • Ensure that day-end processing activities comply with relevant regulations, standards, and security protocols to protect sensitive data and maintain regulatory compliance. • Maintain accurate records and documentation of day-end processing activities, including procedures, logs, and incident reports, to support auditing and continuous improvement efforts. • Provide training and guidance to team members to enhance their skills and knowledge related to day-end processing procedures and best practices. • Facilitate clear and timely communication with stakeholders, including management, other departments, and external partners, to keep them informed of day-end processing status and any relevant issues. • Identify opportunities for process improvements and efficiency gains in day-end processing operations, and collaborate with team members and other stakeholders to implement changes effectively.

Sector: Records Management & Document Control (Administration & Office Support)
Job Responsibilities: Change people's lives and love what you do! Cochlear develops world-leading medical devices that help people hear. As a top 100 medical device company and market-leader in implantable hearing devices, more people choose a Cochlear-branded cochlear implant system than any other. Our employees tell us that the number one reason they enjoy working for Cochlear is the opportunity to make a difference to people's lives. The purpose of the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) Configuration Controller is to provide support to the PLM users, collect metrics, generate reports, audit and maintain data and facilitate the implementation of promotions and product changes. This will enable Cochlear to meet its regulatory and commercial objectives. The PLM Configuration Controller contributes to a geographically dispersed Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) Configuration Management Team that has global responsibility for setting, maintaining and enforcing product configuration and change management standards across Cochlear. Key Responsibilities Accountability 1: PLM System and User Support Manage PLM user issues, working with the Configuration Management Team to prioritize and resolve user service calls. Monitor and track problems with the completion PLM system tasks. Support and work with the PLM users to prioritize the completion of tasks and help ensure a smooth progression of product promotions and changes from proposal to implementation. Assist with the development of training material to support the users of the PLM system and the Configuration Management Team. Assist the PLM users to ensure the integrity of the data in the PLM system is maintained and soft copy documents stored in accordance with our standards and procedures. Manage PLM user issues, working with the Configuration Management Team to prioritize and resolve user service calls. Complete any assigned workflow tasks for the creation of new review workflows in the PLM System, conducting part and document quality checks and the correct review team is assigned, ensuring compliance with our standards and procedures. Provide support to PLM system users on the correct use of the PLM system. Be a PLM system super user who provides support and expert advice to other users. Accountability 2: Collect PLM Metrics and Generate Reports Define the PLM metrics and collection method requirements for the PLM System. Generate and distribute regular reports from the PLM System that provide visibility on the status of open workflows. Generate and distribute metrics that indicate the status of data and efficiency of the system use. Provide visibility of the success or failure against defined KPIs. Generate and distribute other reports from the PLM System on request. Assist the PLM Configuration Management Team Lead in the design of new reports that can be generated from the PLM System. Accountability 3: Audit and Maintain the PLM System Data Support and work with the PLM users to ensure the integrity of the data in the PLM system is maintained and soft copy documents stored in accordance with the relevant standards and procedure. Assist in the conduct of audits of the data within the PLM system to identify areas requiring correction or improvement, such as duplicates, incomplete records, missing documents or approvals. Support and work with the Configuration Management Team and PLM users to make corrections to the data in the PLM system to ensure compliance with the relevant standards and procedures. Remediate system data to ensure it aligns with current standards and practices. Accountability 4: PLM Implementation of Promotions and Changes Ensure that product implementation into the ERP Systems completed and maintained in accordance with the relevant approved procedures. Work with all departments and the Configuration Management Team to support the ongoing use of the PLM system and ERP implementation activities. Support and work with the Configuration Management Team to prioritize activities and help ensure a smooth progression of product promotions and changes from proposal to implementation. Complete any assigned workflow tasks to route the promotion or change for implementation activities. Accountability 5: PLM Configuration Management Activity Management Support the Configuration Management Team to resolve Cochlear Service Portal Calls that are related to the PLM system. Be responsible for the overall performance of one or more Configuration Management activities as assigned. Collaborate with other team members to ensure that the assigned activities are being managed and completed within the required timeframes and to the required level of quality. Report progress or issues to the PLM Configuration Management Lead. Provide support to the Configuration Management Team Lead in identifying and applying any specific project related configuration management requirements. Complete other configuration management activities as required. Key Requirements: Possess minimum of Bachelor education in any related field with minimum 2 years of relevant experience as a document controller or similar in any industry. Knowledge in change management and document control would be highly preferable with the exposure of working within multinational company. Experience with PLM tools i.e PPM, Windchill and Jama would be ideal to have. Must be computer literate especially in the usage of MS Office applications. Attention to detail as this role would highly involve proofreading in a structured format. Strong communication skills with the ability to write clear and concise email as well as managing difficult conversation at any level. Experience working with product development configuration and change processes. Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively at different levels of the organization and across functional disciplines. JOB PURPOSE The Senior System and Process Analyst plays a critical role in optimizing processes and systems to enhance operational efficiency and service delivery at Campus Central, as well as potentially other support departments. This position involves analyzing current workflows, identifying improvement opportunities, and implementing innovative solutions that align with the Department's strategic goals. The role also requires close collaboration with stakeholders across departments to ensure seamless integration of systems and processes that support the institution’s academic and administrative objectives. AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITIES System and Process Analysis Analyze existing systems, workflows, and processes to identify inefficiencies and areas for improvement. Conduct needs assessments and gather requirements from team members and stakeholders to ensure solutions align with institutional / departmental goals. Evaluate and recommend technology solutions to enhance operational performance. Process Improvement and Implementation Design and document streamlined workflows and processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness. Develop and implement process improvements, ensuring minimal disruption to operations. Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of implemented changes and refine as needed. System Support and Integration Collaborate with ICT teams to ensure systems are optimized and aligned with institutional requirements. Facilitate the integration of new systems or enhancements with existing platforms. Provide technical support and troubleshooting for system-related issues. Stakeholder Engagement Work closely within the department and across the academic and administrative teams to understand their operational needs and challenges. Conduct workshops and training sessions to support staff in adopting new systems and processes. Serve as a liaison between departments to ensure clear communication and alignment on system changes. Data Management and Reporting Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and analytics to track process performance and outcomes. Ensure data integrity and security within systems and processes. Provide actionable insights to support decision-making. JOB SPECIFICATIONS MINIMUM ACADEMIC / PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATION Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field. At least 5 years of relevant experience in process analysis, system implementation, or a similar role, preferably within a higher education or comparable organizational environment. COMPETENCIES (KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES) Proficiency in system analysis, workflow design, process mapping, and project management software. Strong troubleshooting skills using database reporting tools, Microsoft applications, and other technical resources. Proficient in data visualization tools such as Power BI to deliver actionable insights. Strong analytical abilities to manage complex information, objectively capture user requirements, and identify trends. Innovative problem-solving skills to develop creative and practical solutions to organizational challenges. Exceptional interpersonal and negotiation skills to engage effectively with technical, academic, and administrative stakeholders at all levels, able to understand and influence user requirements to align with organizational goals. Skilled in communicating complex issues clearly and guiding stakeholders through change initiatives. Strong oral and written communication abilities, including experience in creating and delivering training programs. COMPETENCIES (BEHAVIOURAL) Strong commitment to fostering a customer-centric culture and collaborating effectively in team-based environments. Proven ability to work independently, manage multiple projects, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced setting. Demonstrates professionalism through courteous behavior, good manners, and adherence to workplace etiquette. Embraces diverse perspectives and approaches with an open and adaptable mindset. Strong focus on accuracy, precision, and delivering high-quality outcomes. Flexible and resilient in adapting to evolving technologies, priorities, and organizational changes.

Essential Functions Manage and oversee requests from portfolio companies, including financing rounds, transactions, and material changes. Coordinate end-to-end processes, from document review to legal coordination and fund disbursement. Ensure timely and accurate completion of all incoming communications and documentation. Facilitate deal execution by managing internal and external stakeholders across multiple jurisdictions. Maintain and organize investment and portfolio documentation in a centralized shared drive. Extract, reconcile, and update critical investment data in internal tracking systems. Provide regular and ad hoc portfolio reporting and analysis to the investment team. Support finance and investment teams in quarterly fund accounting and audit processes. Identify and implement AI-driven solutions to enhance workflow efficiency and reduce manual workload. Develop AI-based analyses to improve decision-making and generate strategic insights. Conduct market research and financial analysis to support investment decisions. Perform due diligence and maintain detailed records to inform investment memorandums. Assist in preparing investment memorandums and presentations for internal discussions.

Company Name: Capital Dynamics Asset Management Sdn Bhd
Job Responsibilities: Are you passionate in database platforms, whether commercial or open source ? Do you like to solve complex and high scale data challenges in a business environment ? Do you want to have an impact in the database architect, design, development for our data processing systems ? Databases are the backbone of our business operations, and we need them to be secure, reliable, dynamic and scalable enough to handle vast amounts of information and keep our operations running smoothly while keeping updated with changing requirements. A Database Developer/Designer is responsible for (1) Database design and architecture, data analysis, data modeling, data solutioning; (2) Interpreting data requirements from business processes; (3) Designing conceptual, logical and physical data models with corresponding metadata; (4) Implementing necessary database tables to support application development; (5) Maintaining, supporting, and troubleshooting existing databases; (6) Reverse engineering databases; (7) Driving best practices to guide development teams on database programming. You will develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems, and recommend improvements to meet industry standards and regulatory requirements. Requirements: A solid Computer Science degree is compulsory. A Master's degree in Computer Science and professional certifications in various database platforms would be an asset. A solid and wide-reaching foundation in programming and database structures as well as an in-depth understanding of different applicable business scenarios underlying your database design and solution proposals. Strong knowledge of SQL and No-SQL databases, ETL processes, replication, cloud database services and shell scripting on Linux and other modern technology platforms. Expertise in at least one of these database systems: PostgreSQL / SQL Server / MySQL / Redis / MongoDB / DynamoDB. At least 3 years of relevant experience in managing databases, system integrations, and detailed knowledge of more than one database system are required. Experience with database design and architecture, database programming, database optimization and tuning, data analysis, data modeling, data integration, and data warehousing. Experience creating logical entities and defining their attributes as well as defining the relationships between the various data objects. A creative and analytical problem solver with strong communication and interpersonal skills. This career opportunity is available in our following office(s).
