Req ID: 125413 Remote Position: No Region: Asia Country: Malaysia State/Province: Kedah City: Kulim General Overview Functional Area: OPS - Operations Career Stream: SUP - Operations Support Role: Specialist SAP Short Name: SPE Job Title: Operations Support Specialist Job Code: SPE-OPS-SUP Job Level: Band 08 Direct/Indirect Indicator: Indirect Detailed Description • Coach & mentor team on the Lean or Kaizen process to achieve company goal on lead time improvement & continuous growth target to use the appropriated tools and techniques with DMAIC/DMADV/Or others lean methodology. • Initiate or facilitate the operation team in identifying the key areas of improvement, setting goals, and developing action plans to meet the Lean Operation strategy • Organizes and facilitates any Daily Kaizen Activity, Team Excellence and other project competition. • Promotes continuous improvement culture in the organization. • Collaborate with other departments on continuous improvement projects by providing technical support and facilitating. • Reports out statistics on the Lean Six Sigma related KPIs to drive for continuous improvement culture • Collaborate with the leadership team to assess the critical value streams, processes and practices as compared to lean company benchmarks, both internal and external, establish a transformation plan based on the prioritized gaps as context for the application of kaizen events/Workshop. • Develop a culture of problem solving at all levels of the organization and proficiency with problem solving techniques appropriate for each level. • Manage Lean or Kaizen improvement projects and to deliver project objectives within the timeline and budget/Cost saving. Knowledge/Skills/Competencies Preferable 3-5 years in Lean Six Sigma coaching and/or project leader. Certified Lean Six Sigma Green Belt, Lean Six Sigma Black Belt or equivalent certification or experiences with proven. Degree in Technology Operation/ Business Mathematics/ Applied Mathematics/ Information Technology Management/ Operation Management/ Data Science or equivalent qualification Proficiency in Lean Concepts and familiarity with Lean Tools Notes This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities of the position. Employees are held accountable for all duties of the job. Job duties and the % of time identified for any function are subject to change at any time. Celestica is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on any protected status (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran or disability status or other characteristics protected by law). At Celestica we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Special arrangements can be made for candidates who need it throughout the hiring process. Please indicate your needs and we will work with you to meet them. COMPANY OVERVIEW: Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) enables the world’s best brands. Through our recognized customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in Aerospace and Defense, Communications, Enterprise, HealthTech, Industrial, Capital Equipment and Energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. As a leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions, Celestica brings global expertise and insight at every stage of product development – from drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services for products from advanced medical devices, to highly engineered aviation systems, to next-generation hardware platform solutions for the Cloud. Headquartered in Toronto, with talented teams spanning 40+ locations in 13 countries across the Americas, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers. Celestica would like to thank all applicants, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted. Celestica does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services. Job Segment: Supply Chain, Operations Manager, Supply, Technical Support, Operations, Technology

Company Name: AIR LIQUIDE BUSINESS SERVICES SDN BHD
Job Responsibilities: ALBS is an Air Liquide entity in Kuala Lumpur, regrouping for the APAC scope its Business Service Centers (Kuala Lumpur and Shanghai) as well as the two Global Functions (IT, Digital and Procurement). Designed to derive optimal value by better leveraging technology, people and competencies, the ultimate goal is to boost efficiency and deliver outstanding and sustainable performance while keeping a strong focus on customer centricity. This Organization is striving for excellence, adopting the Best in Class models to deliver value through simplification and standardization of processes, while adhering to Internal controls and compliance requirements. The candidate will have to provide operational services, mainly support to industrial operations, to the Bulk Supply Chain solutions over their complete value chain: from Industrial Assets connection and monitoring, to optimization and performance, via custom apps development and data management. How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW? How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW? The candidate will have to provide operational services, mainly support to industrial operations, to the Bulk Supply Chain solutions over their complete value chain: from Industrial Assets connection and monitoring, to optimization and performance, via custom apps development and data management. Assist functionally and technically users with contractual commitments of the use of solutions. Provide Level 2 support services for off-the-shelf / custom solutions or applications related with ALTO (Bulk Supply organization, optimization, and dispatching). Carry out, implement and monitor action plans aimed at continuous improvement of the service (improve solution and customer knowledge, reduction of incidents, increase resolution ratio/s...). Set up and monitor key activities of the solution within its ecosystem to improve the operational performance of the customer. Propose solutions to increase the reliability and quality of the applications as well as to reduce operating and on call costs while ensuring an adequate level of security. Participate actively in the updating of application’s documentation linked to support activities. Are you a MATCH? Are you a MATCH? University Degree or Diploma in Information Technology or Computer science. Minimum of 3 years of experience in the field of information systems, including 2 years as an application/system support. Relevant experience in testing, troubleshooting and systems support activities. Good knowledge of the basic concepts of the MS SQL Server database systems, or any Relational Database. Good knowledge of scripting languages (PowerShell, PL/SQL and TSQL). Good communication skills. About Air Liquide A world leader in gases, technologies and services for Industry and Health, Air Liquide is present in 78 countries with approximately 64,500 employees and serves more than 3.8 million customers and patients. Oxygen, nitrogen and hydrogen are essential small molecules for life, matter and energy. They embody Air Liquide’s scientific territory and have been at the core of the company’s activities since its creation in 1902. Our Differences make our Performance At Air Liquide, we are committed to build a diverse and inclusive workplace that embraces the diversity of our employees, our customers, patients, community stakeholders and cultures across the world. We welcome and consider applications from all qualified applicants, regardless of their background. We strongly believe a diverse organization opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to innovate by living our fundamentals, acting for our success and creating an engaging environment in a changing world.

Job Title: Senior/Operations Executive, ePension (HK Support) Up to RM5,500
Company Name: iFAST Global Hub AI Sdn Bhd
Job Responsibilities: About us: At ePension, we’re driving the future of retirement savings by transitioning the administration process into streamlined, digital platform. We’re looking for passionate, detail-oriented individuals to join our team and help us transform how Hong Kong’s workforce manages their retirement savings. This is a unique opportunity to be part of a fast-evolving industry and learn from the ground up in a dynamic, supportive environment. Ready to take the first step in your career with us? What You’ll Do: As an ePension Operation Executive, you’ll be at the forefront of the transition to the platform, helping individuals and employers manage their account. You’ll play an important role in ensuring that every step of the process runs smoothly, from registration and enrollment to payments and claims. The Key Responsibilities: Data Input and Accuracy - Accurately input transaction applications received. Ensure data entered into the system is correct and complete. Process Management and Document Verification - Understand and follow each process in the transaction cycle, including Registration, Enrollment, Data Modification, Contribution, Payment, Termination, Transfer, Investment, Claim, Document Management and Enquiries. - Check documents submitted to ensure they are complete and in compliance with the regulations. Compliance and Quality Assurance - Ensure strict adherence to regulations, internal guidelines, standard operating procedures (SOPs) and service level agreements (SLAs). - Collaborate with relevant team to resolve any discrepancies or issues. Client Communication and Clarification - Make outbound calls or send correspondence to clarify any missing or unclear information in submitted applications. - Provide clear explanations and guidance to clients on how to complete their application. Issue Investigation and Resolution - Investigate and analyze applications that have been rejected or failed validation. - Identify issues and work with relevant teams to resolve them in a timely and efficient manner. User Acceptance Testing (UAT) - Participate in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to validate system functionality and stability. - Work closely with the development teams to identify defects and ensure proper follow-up. Inquiry Handling - Respond to inquiries regarding to transaction issues, application statuses, account balance and other related matters. - Investigate transaction issues and provide resolutions within the required SLAs. Document Management - Index and categorize documents to ensure correct and accurate account information is associated with each application. - Perform investigations if an account cannot be located or matched during document indexing. Payment Processing and Matching - Process payments and ensure they are properly matched with contributions within the required timelines. - Ensure all payment-related tasks comply with internal standards and regulatory requirements. We are looking for a team member with: - Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and document verification. - Willingness to adapt and learn in dynamic and transitional environment. - Strong organizational, time-management and problem-solving skills to handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines. - A proactive team player with the ability to work collaboratively. - Excellent command of spoken and written English and Mandarin/Cantonese to effectively communicate with Mandarin/Cantonese-speaking internal or external parties. - Willingness to work on Malaysia public holidays, following the Hong Kong public holiday schedule. - 5.5-day work week: Monday to Friday (full day) and Saturdays (half day). - 100% work in office. Able to work on shift arrangement. Perks and Benefits: • Employee Share Options / Performance Shares : The company introduced the Share Options / Performance Shares Plan to recognize employees' contributions and achievements in the growth of the company. • Investment : 0% sales charge for unit trust & 50% staff rebate on front end charges for stocks and ETFs * if you invest through our platform. • Snacks & Beverages : Enjoy a variety of snacks and drinks from vending machines, including fresh-brewed espresso, Americano, and more from the coffee machine. Additionally, we have a weekly Breakfast Day and Fruits Day ! • Relaxation : Access to a relaxation room equipped with massage chairs at all times to help you relieve tiredness and stress. • Yearly Activities : Participation in outdoor activities, celebrations during festive seasons, and more exciting events! • Remuneration Package : Competitive salary packages that are well above market rates for those with the right potential. • Annual Salary Review and Yearly Bonus : Both processes will be conducted depending on the company's performance and individual work performance. • Coverage : Comprehensive insurance along with Medical, Dental & Optical coverage. • Allowances : Monthly sports allowance, Enjoy yearly department gatherings, and welcome lunches for new staffs. • Training : Benefit from free external and internal training providers, ensuring continuous learning and development. • Annual Leave : Entitlement to 21 days of annual leave. These benefits are designed to enhance your overall well-being and ensure a rewarding working experience with us. Applicants are invited to email us a comprehensive resume with the following details via "Apply Now" button with: Qualifications Skills Working Experience Expected Salary All applications will be treated in strict confidence. We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified. Note: Job responsibilities / requirements are representative and are not intended to be a detailed list. Other tasks/abilities may be required of the incumbent, relative to the specific assignment.

Job Title: Manufacturing Operations Management System (MOM) IT System Support Specialist
Job Responsibilities: We are seeking a skilled and motivated MOM System Support & Specialist to manage, troubleshoot, and optimize the Manufacturing Operations Management (MOM) systems. This role will involve working closely with production teams, IT, and other departments to ensure the smooth operation of MOM software, improve manufacturing processes, and provide ongoing support and training to end-users. Duties include, but are not limited to the following: MOM System Implementation & Configuration: Support the implementation and configuration of MOM systems to meet business requirements. Participate in training to understand the architecture of the MOM system to support manufacturing processes, including production planning, inventory management, quality control, and more. Collaborate with other departments to understand process requirements and map them into the MOM system. System Maintenance & Optimization: Perform regular system maintenance, including software updates, patches, and backups. Monitor system performance to ensure optimal operation and identify any issues or bottlenecks. Troubleshoot and resolve any system issues or errors, ensuring minimal downtime. Analyze production data to recommend improvements in workflows and performance. User Support and Training: Provide user support for MOM system-related issues and inquiries. Train new and existing employees on the proper use of MOM software and its features. Develop user manuals and troubleshooting guides for employees. Collaboration with IT and Other Teams: Work closely with the IT department to ensure proper integration of the MOM system with other enterprise systems (ERP, PLM, QMS, etc.). Participate in cross-functional meetings to align MOM system goals with overall business objectives. Data Management & Reporting: Assist in the creation and management of production reports, KPIs, and performance metrics within the MOM system. Generate ad-hoc reports as needed to support decision-making. Ensure data integrity within the system by performing regular audits. Process Improvement: Continuously assess the manufacturing processes to identify opportunities for improvement through system enhancements. Work with the production team to streamline workflows and reduce inefficiencies. Documentation & Compliance: Maintain clear documentation of system configurations, troubleshooting steps, and processes. Ensure the MOM system complies with regulatory requirements and industry standards. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Manufacturing, or a related field (or equivalent work experience). 3-5 years of experience working with MOM, Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES), or similar systems in a manufacturing environment. Experience in system administration, support, and troubleshooting. Familiarity with ERP systems (SAP S4 Hana) and integration with MOM. Strong understanding of MOM software, data management, and system optimization. Experience with programming languages (SQL, Java, etc.) for system integration and reporting. Knowledge of production processes, manufacturing workflows, and related technologies. Experience with reporting tools and business intelligence software. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills. Excellent communication skills for training and support. Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills. Ability to work well in cross-functional teams and collaborate with various departments. Experience with specific MOM software platforms (e.g., Siemens Opcenter, Rockwell FactoryTalk, etc.). Certifications in relevant systems or technologies. Familiarity with lean manufacturing, Six Sigma, or other process improvement methodologies. Proficient in Mandarin will be an added advantage.

Summary We are seeking a qualified team leader to manage our team and provide effective guidance. This role involves managing the day-to-day operations of the team, providing guidance and support, and ensuring that project deadlines and quality standards are met. As the contact point for all team members, your communication skills should be excellent. You should also be able to act proactively to ensure smooth team operations and effective collaboration. The Annotator Team Leader will oversee a team of annotators, ensuring the quality and efficiency of data labeling processes, and be willing to wear multiple hats as a Trainer and Quality Lead. Provide training to new team members and ongoing support to existing staff. Identify areas for improvement in the annotation process and implement changes as needed. Work closely with project managers and other stakeholders to ensure project requirements are met. Generate reports on team performance and project progress. Address any issues or challenges that arise within the team. Ensure the team is compliant and to be high on integrity regarding Data privacy. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in any discipline. 4-5 years experience in a team leader role, particularly in data annotation or a related field. Experience with specific annotation tools and platforms. Understanding of the domain relevant to the annotation project. Proven ability to lead and motivate a team. Strong attention to detail and commitment to quality. Familiarity with data annotation tools and software. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong organizational and time management skills. Decision making skills Ability to analyze problems and implement effective solutions. In-depth knowledge of performance metrics. Experience in managing a Team Ability to calibrate with the stakeholders and cascade the same to the team Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze data to identify trends and patterns.

Company Description Established in 1961, Malayan Flour Mills Berhad (MFM) is the pioneer in the flour milling industry in Malaysia. MFM has grown to become the leading flour miller in Malaysia with presence in Vietnam and Indonesia. Over the years, we have expanded into poultry integration, aquaculture, and raw material trading. In FY23, the group revenue was RM2.15 billion. With a workforce of 3,000, MFM has experienced significant growth both locally and regionally. Partnering with Tyson Food, Inc. and Toyota Tsusho Group, we aim to be a leading global halal food enterprise while pursuing sustainable development goals. Building the workforce of the future... today. We invite you to join our team! Job Description Responsible for analyzing data, operations and contract terms for commodity purchases. Identify market trends and correlations to recommend trading strategies and actions for risk management and inventory management of raw materials to meet the company’s strategic goals and objectives. To conduct data analysis on historical data (using VBA, Python, and other programming languages) to determine the seasonality trends and correlations of commodity prices using Refinitiv, Trading View, etc. To work closely with the Senior Purchasing Support Executive on operations and contract terms for commodity purchases. Responsible for enhancing back testing model and optimizing entry & exit strategy. Strategize procurement plans to optimize raw material costs, grain inventory, and financing costs. Importation stats and other data update. Manage inventory and planning for plants. Implement solutions regarding alternative grain types and grain origination. To compile weather, news, and market data daily to keep management and other departments updated with the latest market conditions. Work closely with stakeholders to conduct effective purchase planning for commodities. Ensure shipment arrival on time to meet production requirements. Plan effective storage for commodities. Work closely with international commodity suppliers. Perform price comparison and provide market updates. Prepare and present periodic reports. Recommend the next course of action based on analysis. To perform any other tasks and assignments as directed by the management from time to time. Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Engineering, or Actuarial Science Highly skilled in Excel VBA and Python programming language 3-5 years in commodity trade, procurement, shipment documentation and operations Additional Information Winner of HR Asia Best Company to Work For in Asia for 7 consecutive years in 2024, 2023, 2022, 2021, 2020, 2019 & 2018 Winner of HR Asia Most Caring Company Award for 6 consecutive years in 2024, 2023, 2022, 2021, 2020 & 2019 Winner of HR Asia Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Award for 2 consecutive years in 2024 & 2023 Winner of HR Asia Sustainable Workplace Award in 2024 Winner of HR Asia Happiest Workplace Award in 2024

Key Responsibilities: POS System Management: Install, configure, and maintain the outlet's POS system, ensuring it is functioning correctly and meeting business needs. Troubleshoot and resolve any technical issues with the POS system, promptly addressing any disruptions in service. Conduct routine system checks and updates to ensure optimal performance and security. Train new staff on the POS system, including order entry, payment processing, and other relevant functions. Data Analysis and Reporting: Extract and analyze data from the POS system to generate reports on sales, inventory, customer behavior, and employee performance. Customer Service: Provide prompt and courteous support to staff and customers regarding POS system issues. Assist in resolving customer complaints related to the POS system, ensuring a positive experience. Strong understanding of POS system functionality, including order processing, inventory management, and reporting. Ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues. Proficiency in data analysis and report generation. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.

About Our Company Monitor ERP System AB is a leading provider of enterprise resource planning (ERP) solutions, specializing in manufacturing industries. Founded in 1974 in Hudiksvall, Sweden, the company has grown into a global player, serving more than 6,000 manufacturing companies worldwide. With over 500 employees and operations in 13 countries, Monitor ERP offers a powerful, user-friendly, and fully integrated ERP system that helps businesses optimize their processes, improve efficiency, and drive profitability. RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. Weighing Operations Management Operate and monitor weighbridge systems or other weighing equipment. Ensure accurate recording of incoming and outgoing goods' weight. Verify weight tickets, receipts, or invoices for accuracy. Compare and report any significant discrepancies in weight measurements. Calibrate weighing equipment regularly to ensure accuracy. Identify and report any malfunctions in weighing systems. 2. Data Entry & Documentation Maintain accurate records of weight data in company systems. Generate reports related to weight transactions. Ensure compliance with company policies and legal weight limits. Good receipt (GR) for incoming items. 3. Coordination & Communication Work closely with warehouse, logistics, or operation teams to ensure smooth operations. Communicate with drivers, suppliers, and customers regarding weight-related issues. Assist in resolving disputes related to weighing discrepancies. 4. General Administrative Support Handle invoices, permits, or other relevant documentation related to weighing operations. Support daily administrative tasks, including filing, scheduling, courier services and correspondence. Assist in stock or inventory control by providing weight-based data. Any other duties assigned from time to time by the Management. REQUIREMENTS: Candidate must possess at least SPM or equivalent. Candidate with Weighbridge experience would be an added advantage. Required skill(s): MS Office (Excel & Word). Ability to work independently. For more information on our company, please visit us at:- Website: https://www.tmkchemical.com Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/tmkchemical *Kindly be informed that only short-listed candidates will be notified.

Responsibilities About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. Why Join Us Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Join us. About The e-commerce industry has seen tremendous growth in recent years and has become a hotly contested space amongst leading Internet companies, and its future growth cannot be underestimated. With millions of loyal users globally, we believe TikTok is an ideal platform to deliver a brand new and better e-commerce experience to our users. We aim to bring discovery, inspiration, and joy back to shopping by making TikTok the commerce channel of choice for merchants, creators, and affiliates. With millions of loyal users globally, we believe TikTok is an ideal platform to deliver a brand new and better e-commerce experience to our users. We are looking for passionate and talented people to join our product and operations team, to build an e-commerce ecosystem that is innovative, secure and intuitive for our users and brands. About the team In this role, you will be part of Malaysia TikTok Shop Category & Merchant Strategy's Assortment Operations function, driving key assortment operations projects with strategic research, data analytics, and project management Responsibilities Be part of the team in charge of Malaysia TikTok Shop's assortment growth strategy and operations Responsible for the execution of assortment growth operations, including target assortment identification, Cluster team collaborations, and assortment support resources operations Responsible for analytics of assortment growth operations, including evaluation of potential product identification methodology, evaluation of support resources effectiveness, and deep dive analysis per Cluster situations Qualifications Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent practical experience Minimum 5 years working experience. Past experience in e-commerce platform's assortment operations is strongly preferred Have strong sense of data and analytics. Must be fluent in Excel-based analytics. Past working experience with SQL is strongly preferred Preferred Qualifications Eager to learn and always up to take on new challenges. Experience in dynamic and fast-changing working environments is strongly preferred Open to flexible working arrangement outside of regular working hours per business requirements, and open to business travels TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Job Title: DRSC CRM Operation Support (Analyst/Consultant), AP Growth
Location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur
Job Responsibilities: Title: Asia Pacific CRM Support (based in Kuala Lumpur) – Analyst/Fresh Graduate Are you ready to unleash your potential? At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve. We believe we have a responsibility to be a force for good, and WorldImpact is our portfolio of initiatives focused on making a tangible impact on society’s biggest challenges and creating a better future. We strive to advise clients on how to deliver purpose-led growth and embed more equitable, inclusive as well as sustainable business practices. Hence, we seek talented individuals driven to excel and innovate, working together to achieve our shared goals. We are committed to creating positive work experiences that foster a culture of respect and inclusion, where diverse perspectives are celebrated, and everyone is recognised for their contributions. Ready to unleash your potential with us? Join the winning team now! Work you'll do Deloitte Asia Pacific brings together our geographies in Australia, China, Japan, Korea, South Asia, Southeast Asia, New Zealand and Taiwan with more than 4,000 partners and 90,000 professionals. The formation of the Deloitte Asia Pacific Member Firm enhances our ability to provide a more seamless client experience across geographical boundaries, while at the same time offering you unique and unrivalled career experiences and opportunities. The AP Growth organization within Deloitte Asia Pacific is responsible for driving growth and alignment in sales processes across the Deloitte network in the region in order to deliver a consistent experience and the very best of Deloitte to our priority clients and strategic sectors in the region. Our goal is to serve our clients and sectors with quality and distinction and make a measurable, tangible, and attributable impact. An exciting opportunity to join as CRM Operation Support in our CRM Enablement Team which oversees Jupiter, our internal Global CRM platform (Salesforce). The CRM Enablement team covers three core pillars Adoption, Functionality, and User Support responsible for maximizing value for our front office teams and providing a consistent experience for our clients. Jupiter represents a major step forward in Deloitte’s digital transformation journey enabling us to manage, retain, and grow our client relationships, regardless of where our clients or we are in the world. Jupiter is established in over 60 countries making it one of the largest global Salesforce deployments. Job highlights: Support & Collaboration Be the go-to contact for CRM user inquiries through AP Support and ServiceNow, ensuring quick and efficient resolution. Collaborate with Global teams and Local Admins to resolve issues seamlessly. Data Management & Optimization Lead efforts to maintain CRM data accuracy, manage accounts and opportunity data, and identify/report process gaps to drive improvements and efficiency. Internal Communication Create and share a monthly newsletter and ad-hoc updates to keep the team informed. Maintain and update internal communication channels like the Teams site and intranet. Responsibilities Participate in and drive Deloitte’s digital transformation by increasing user adoption, capturing accurate data, and delivering meaningful insights. Provide Client & Sales insights for key stakeholders across business units in Asia Pacific. Promote analytics-driven decision making and transform CRM data into actionable insights. Support CRM operations around sales management, reporting, and marketing. Manage CRM data quality and ensure data quality and data accuracy. Develop reports/dashboards using Salesforce/PowerBI. Advise on best practices in application set-up, workflow, and customizations. Identify reporting issues, gaps in processes, and drive timely resolutions. Ad-hoc CRM related matters and areas you would like to drive improvement. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in any field demonstrating rigorous thinking and ability to articulate complex ideas such as Engineering, Programming, Literature, Data Analysis, etc., is preferred. Fresh graduates or individuals with 1 year of experience are encouraged to apply. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must. Strong preference for working knowledge of CRM or ERP systems and experience with business processes, analytics, data, predictive modeling, or business intelligence. Attention to detail, analytical and logical problem-solving skills, and the ability to think critically are essential. Proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint, along with a passion for working with data to identify trends and make recommendations, are highly valued. Familiarity with concepts like Macro/SQL/HTML/Python is advantageous. Ability to effectively engage with busy leaders and professionals. Fluency in English is required, and proficiency in another Asian language is a plus. Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Candidates will only be contacted by authorised Deloitte Recruiters via firm’s business contact number or business email address.

Company Description Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realize their financial goals and help them save time and money. We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments. We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com. Job Description Job description The Reporting Analyst position is essential to the continuous evolution of our financial reporting processes. With a focus on digital transformation for finance, the primary objective of this role is to support a variety of critical activities within the Digital Insights operations, ensuring support for our internal finance stakeholders. This role is pivotal in designing, building, testing, and implementing finance reports within the CXO-Cockpit application, while also establishing robust governance and maintenance processes to support our finance community effectively. Brief About our team The Global Finance Digital Insights team, comprising over 30 talented professionals, serves Experian's finance teams across the globe, including locations in Nottingham (UK), Sofia (Bulgaria), Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia), Costa Mesa & Texas (USA), Bogota (Colombia), and Sao Paulo (Brazil). Our team of finance and IT specialists collaborates to manage Experian's financial reporting systems, ensuring integrity, accuracy, and consistency. We are also at the forefront of defining and deploying new reporting applications and management information tools. What you'll be doing Report design Build relationships with the finance community to collaborate and determine new report requirements. Develop reports in CXO-Cockpit to meet these requirements. Provide best practice report design advice, troubleshoot & improve existing report design Content reviews Conduct cyclical reviews of all application content to improve and align reports. Collaborate with the software provider to assess new features and request system improvements Identify gaps in report templates and implement improvements. Expand use-cases for current reports to promote global adoption. Application management Perform report and application maintenance activities. Lead system management of reporting cycles (Budget, QPRs, HYR). Develop governance and control processes. Monitor report performance, use best-in-practice scripting skills to improve speed Provide coaching for team members. Process Improvement Enhance internal team processes. Manage support tickets in the ServiceNow queue during APAC hours, ensuring resolution. Manage external and internal documents, including access and security instructions and developer process notes. User support Develop finance user training documentation. Manage end-user provisioning and access. Qualifications Qualifications Education: Degree preferrable in finance or IT technical courses. Experience minimum 3+ years proven experience in reporting and data analytics, within a finance function Effective Communicator: Confident speaker with excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Data Visualization: Strong knowledge of data visualization techniques. Technical Expertise: Familiarity with finance reporting applications such as Tableau, Power BI, CXO-Cockpit, Hyperion, OBIEE, Business Objects, etc. Advanced Skills: expertise in Excel (advanced) and PowerPoint. Additional Knowledge: Awareness of SQL/MDX language is a plus. Additional Information Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are important differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Experian's people first approach is award-winning; World's Best WorkplacesTM 2024 (Fortune Top 25), Great Place To WorkTM in 24 countries, and Glassdoor Best Places to Work 2024 to name a few. Check out Experian Life on social or our Careers Site to understand why. Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Innovation is an important part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity. Job Title: Banking Operations – Analyst, MSME (Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprise)
Job Responsibilities: Responsibilities Be our Analyst in our Business Banking Operations - Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSME) Collaborate with product, customer experience and business to create a robust operation process that delight our customers where it matters most. Use advanced data analytics to explore operations issues/opportunities, uncover insights and/or identify targeted areas for efficiency improvement and risk mitigation. Ensure day-to-day operations comply with the regulatory and internal requirements. Leverage technology to drive a high degree of digitalisation and scalability. Analyse potential pitfalls across the process cycle for product launches and system roll out, which may impact operations effectiveness. Drive higher degree of effectiveness of control measures. Use big data analysis to discover patterns and potential hot spots Process deposit and loan application, closely follow up on customer submissions until opening of business account or disbursement of the loans are completed. Process all internal operations related to MSME banking on our digital platform transaction processing, and ad-hoc handling. To achieve satisfactory completion rate of all assigned tasks on MSME products The must haves: Process Management - Ability to streamline processes and workflows for MSME banking operations, leveraging digital journey coupled with manual handling techniques to ensure efficiency and accuracy. Issue Resolution - Act as a point of escalation for complex customer edge-cases, complaints, and operational issues, providing timely and effective resolution to maintain high levels of outcome Collaboration -Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product development, business, and customer service, to align MSME banking operations with overall business objectives and strategy. Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or related field. Minimum of 2 years of experience in banking operations, with a focus on MSME segment. Strong understanding of MSME banking processes and procedures, with experience in manual handling within a digital banking environment. Possess prior experience and exposure in processing of business loan applications, will be an added advantage & preferred. Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Good communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders. Knowledge of regulatory requirements and compliance standards governing MSME banking operations. Credit Analyst and Risk Management background will be a plus point for this role.

At Miifix Digital Sdn Bhd, we are more than just a mobile device repair company—we are innovators, problem-solvers, and industry leaders. Established in 2009, we have consistently set the standard for quality and service in the mobile repair industry. Our commitment to excellence has earned us the trust of customers and partners across Malaysia. Our services extend beyond retail; we collaborate closely with insurance companies, educational programs, and trade clients, providing comprehensive solutions that meet diverse needs. Additionally, we are at the forefront of the trade-in sector, continually evolving to offer cutting-edge solutions through strategic partnerships and technology. At Miifix Digital, we believe in pushing boundaries and creating value, not just for our clients, but for the industry as a whole. Join us, and be a part of a dynamic team that's shaping the future of mobile device solutions in Malaysia. Responsibilities: Enter and update inventory data into the company’s inventory management system Ensure that inventory is properly organized and stored in the warehouse according to predefined systems, such as FIFO (First In, First Out) or LIFO (Last In, First Out), based on product type. Oversee the transfer of stock between locations, branches, or warehouses, ensuring that inventory is correctly recorded and accounted for. Regularly perform stock reconciliations and audits to verify that the physical inventory aligns with the system records. Ensure that all inventory transactions (e.g., shipments, returns, stock transfers) are properly documented and entered into the inventory management system. Tasks & responsibilities Oversee all aspects of buyback & trade-in projects, including program deployment at retail stores, daily trade-in operations, promoter management, planning and implementing promotional campaigns, and conducting monthly performance reviews with improvement plans. Collaborate with partners across various industries (OEMs, Telcos, Distributors) within Malaysia to enhance program effectiveness. Coordinate with the team to manage and improve our trade-in mobile app, ensuring cutting-edge trade-in solutions are provided to our diverse partners. Serve as the liaison and primary point of contact between internal business units and external business partners, acting as a project manager to evaluate, prioritize, develop, and deploy device buyback programs at partner retail stores. Contribute to the development and execution of strategic and tactical business plans alongside other members of the cross-functional team supporting the trade in strategy. Undertake other tasks as assigned from time to time. BENEFITS EPF,SOCSO,EIS Spectacle Allowance Annual performance bonus Medical claim Nearby LRT station (LRT KELANA JAYA) 5 Working Days

This position has overall management responsibility of Electronics Manufacturing Services (EMS) to ensure smooth production efficiency and meeting customer requirements in terms of output, delivery and quality. If you think this role is suitable for you, let's go and join our team! In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be: Data collection, reports generation and coordination of activities with EMS to maintain smooth relationship and operation efficiency Track cost reduction activities and targets for each of the EMS sites Report on key performance measures, takes appropriate actions and work to resolve when performance dips below established targets Implement supply chain strategies to exceed business objectives relating to cost, quality and delivery metrics Participate in discussion on business reviews, measuring key performance metrics and drives for continuous improvement Support timely execution on NPIs through coordination with appropriate functions ensuring all business, commercial and technology requirements are adhered Review DDSS/Supply plan weekly as published by EMS and identifies/track component parts that may require premium purchase after ensuring all avenues has been exhausted Validate that component parts requiring premium purchase raised by EMS corresponds to shortages as reflected in the supply plan Ensure the premium price proposed is in tandem with what the open market is offering Monitor inventory dollar value at key EMS sites for both Turnkey and Consignment and challenges EMS if inventory received is excess to demand per lead time Based on inventory monitoring records, approves for month end carrying charges and quarterly turnkey to consignment proposal Ensure that inventory is depleted on a FIFO basis, paying particular attention that consign inventory is being depleted before EMS takes new orders in Work closely with the pricing lead and push back EMS on price increases when the re-pricing activity has just been completed Ensure not to exceed the PPV budget allocated for the year and all key indicators are up to date and reported on time Other duties as assigned or as the business requires Who You Are: You follow through on commitments and make sure others do the same. You act with a clear sense of ownership, take personal responsibility for decisions, actions, and failures, establish clear responsibilities and processes for supervising work and measuring results. You design feedback loops into work. You are effective in a variety of communication settings: one-on-one, small and large groups, or among diverse styles and position levels. Attentively listen to others, adjust to fit the audience and the message and provide timely and helpful information to others across the organization. You work cooperatively with others to achieve shared objectives, represent own interests while being fair to others and their areas as well as partner with others to get work done. For This Role, You Will Need: Good working knowledge of Electronics Manufacturing and Supporting Processes General knowledge of key distributors and brokers in the region to assist with sourcing activities Proficiency with ERP systems (SAP/Oracle, etc.) and Microsoft office Able to handle and process large amount of data accurately Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a good command of both verbal and written English Integrity and courage in highlighting issues and concerns Reviewing proposals and being able to articulate better solutions Self-motivated and able to work with minimal direction Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart: Relevant degree holder with minimum 3 years working experience in similar role in an electronic or contract electronics manufacturing environment Experience with MS Teams/ SharePoint and Data Repository systems Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills Ability to adapt to change Occasional travel may be required Our Offer To You: By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do. Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets. We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees. We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion. We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential. We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company. We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office. Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities. Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.

Get to Know the Team Grab enables Advertisers, Organisations, Agencies, and Merchants to engage the Grab Ecosystem and Grab Audience via innovative offerings. Through our unique ecosystem and transacting user base, our clients are able to reach their desired audiences at scale, while driving measurable business outcomes. We would like you to join our journey to create value for our users, drivers, merchants, and advertising partners while continuing to make everyday lives better across Southeast Asia. Get to Know the Role You will collaborate with Sales Operations, Commercial, Product Analytics, and Finance teams to create strategies, processes, and targets that support Grab's Sales teams. By combining strategic and operational expertise, you'll contribute to sales strategy, customer segmentation, company structure, process improvement, and business analytics. Reporting to the Regional Sales Operations Manager, Sales Ops & Analytics, you'll be based onsite in Petaling Jaya. The Critical Tasks You Will Perform Sales Steering & Performance You will be a key business partner to the Commercial Country Head managing MY & SG and the Country Sales Managers. You will lead the end-to-end execution of Country Market Planning / Business Reviews. You will drive data into monitoring and analyzing key sales and business performance indicators and trends to drive strategic and tactical business decisions, while also coordinating and ensuring the accuracy of sales forecasts. You will support Country Sales Heads and the Sales Team to monitor and forecast revenue performance and other sales KPIs against Quarterly Sales Targets. You will be a tactical to strategic planner, supporting the Sales Team with sales and market data intelligence analysis for business cases using internal and external data. You will partner with Country Sales leadership to define and execute sales strategy, sales policies, processes, and business system requirements. Process Excellence You will maintain the integrity of sales and customer data by driving adoption and proper usage of sales tools, including SalesForce.com. You will enable access to sales data and KPIs via tools like SalesForce.com, Google Sheets, PowerBI, etc. You will enforce pricing and discount policies. You will work with Regional Operations Teams to roll out new solutions to improve the efficiency of Sales Operations processes in the Country.

Job Title: PROCUREMENT ASSISTANT CUM ADMINISTRATION & OFFICE SUPPORT
Company Name: Jones Lang LaSalle Property Consultants Pte Ltd
Job Responsibilities: 1) Purchase Order Management: Ensure accuracy of purchase order details, including pricing, quantities, and delivery terms Coordinate with suppliers to confirm order receipts and evaluation and selection processes Coordinate supplier meetings and site visits as required 3) Contract Administration: Assist in preparing, reviewing, and maintaining procurement contracts Track contract expiration dates and initiate renewal processes Ensure compliance with contractual terms and conditions 4) Cost Savings and Analysis: Assist in conducting market research and price comparisons Prepare cost analysis reports to support decision-making Identify potential areas for cost savings and process improvements 5) Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate and up-to-date procurement files and records Prepare regular procurement reports, including spend analysis and supplier performance Ensure all documentation complies with company policies and auditing requirements Assist in maintaining records for audit purposes Report any potential conflicts of interest or policy violations 8) Tendering and RFP Process: Assist in preparing Request for Proposals (RFPs) and tender documents Coordinate the distribution of RFPs to potential suppliers Manage the receipt and organization of supplier responses Assist in the evaluation of proposals, including creating comparison matrices Support the team in preparing presentation materials for selection committees Maintain confidentiality throughout the tendering process Ensure compliance with company policies and legal requirements in the RFP process 9) Contractual Management: Assist in drafting and reviewing procurement contracts Maintain a centralized contract database, ensuring all documents are up-to-date and easily accessible Track contract expiration dates and initiate renewal processes in a timely manner Monitor supplier performance against contractual terms and report any deviations Assist in contract negotiations by providing relevant data and support materials Ensure all necessary signatures and approvals are obtained for contracts Coordinate with legal department for contract reviews when necessary 10) Comparison Quotes: Solicit quotes from multiple vendors for goods and services Create comprehensive comparison sheets, detailing prices, terms, delivery times, and other relevant factors Analyze quote comparisons to identify the most cost-effective and suitable options Prepare summary reports of quote comparisons for management review Maintain a database of historical quote information for future reference Ensure fair and ethical practices in the quote collection process 11) Market Research and Vendor Evaluations: Conduct regular market research to stay informed about industry trends, new products, and pricing fluctuations Identify potential new suppliers and evaluate their capabilities Assist in creating and maintaining vendor scorecards Analyze supplier performance data and prepare reports Contribute to the development of supplier evaluation criteria Support the team in conducting periodic supplier performance reviews 12) Supplier Meetings and Site Visits: Coordinate and schedule supplier meetings and site visits Prepare agendas and necessary documents for supplier meetings Participate in supplier meetings and take detailed notes Assist in organizing and conducting supplier site visits Prepare reports summarizing key findings from meetings and site visits Follow up on action items resulting from supplier interactions 13) New Vendor Research and Onboarding: Proactively search for and identify potential new vendors in the market Conduct initial screenings of new vendors, including requesting company profiles and capabilities statements Assist in the vendor pre-qualification process, including collecting necessary documentation Coordinate with internal stakeholders to evaluate new vendor suitability Support the onboarding process for approved new vendors Maintain and update the database of potential vendors for future opportunities 14) General Research and Analysis: Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in procurement Conduct research on specific products or services as requested by the procurement team Analyze spending patterns and identify potential areas for cost savings Assist in benchmarking studies to compare company practices with industry standards Prepare research summaries and presentations for management review Admin & Office Support 1) Office Management: Manage Management office reception area, greet visitors, and direct them to appropriate personnel Answer and manage incoming phone calls, emails, and correspondence Maintain a clean, organized, and professional office environment Coordinate office layout and equipment maintenance 2) Administrative Support: Provide general administrative support to various departments as needed Prepare and edit correspondence, reports, presentations, and other documents Organize and maintain file systems, both physical and digital 3) Communication: Act as a liaison between management, employees, and external parties Facilitate effective communication within the organization Respond to inquiries and requests for information promptly and professionally 4) Document Management: Process, organize, and file important documents Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information Ensure proper document retention and disposal according to company policies Prepares a variety of written materials (e.g. correspondence & memos, etc.) 5) Office Supplies and Equipment: Manage inventory and order office supplies & pantry item as needed Coordinate maintenance and repair of office equipment Research and recommend cost-effective suppliers and service providers 6) Vendor Management: Maintain relationships with office vendors and service providers Resolve any issues or discrepancies with vendors 7) Employee Support: Assist with onboarding procedures for new employees Maintain employee records and update as necessary Coordinate with all staffs for various administrative task

Job Title: TikTok LIVE - Workforce Management Real Time Analyst - Malaysia
Sector: Customer Service - Call Centre (Call Centre & Customer Service)
Job Responsibilities: Responsibilities About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo. Why Join Us Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible. Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact-for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve. Join us. About the Team The Livestream Team is committed to creating real-time interactive scenes, As a new form of content, Livestream creates value for all parties in the ecology. Livestream provides users with a unique consumption experience and further generalizes content. It is also a new way of employment to provide more direct fan interaction and deepen relationships with authors; It provides an objective revenue to the platform and promotes content exclusivity. It also serves as a "new infrastructure" for expanding ecological boundaries. Together we can build an innovative, secure, and intuitive live traffic and ecosystem team for our users. The Customer Service Excellence team provides world-class service and experience for customers and creators. We are looking for an exceptional Workforce Management (WFM) Real Time Analyst (RTA), who is passionate about their work, understands how to manage calls across a network of contact centers and in-house customer service teams, having the ability to contribute new innovations to the Tiktok Live PTE Workforce Management Team. The ideal candidate will possess experience in typical workforce management disciplines: Scheduling, Real Time Monitoring, proficient reporting skills, and experience optimizing manpower in customer service environments. The ideal candidate would also support and own proactive tactical workforce management responses to address service level challenges. In this role you will experience a wide range of problem-solving situations that require immediate real time intervention, as well as short term scheduling management and planning. Roles & Responsibilities Monitors queue performance, provide intra-day updates on contact volume and capacity. Takes actions to resolve or reduce service level impacting issues. Provides clear, concise notification to Operations and Support teams as required. Compares staffing to forecast requirements. Takes corrective actions as required examples include: Cross language support, non-productive time cancellation, and OT. Metric reviews including shrinkage, scheduled adherence and contacts handled analysis to improve service levels. Leverages appropriate operational tools and applications to deep dive Demand (Volume/AHT) and Staffing impacts. Utilize data to identify root cause and recommend resolving actions. Coordinate with outsourced service providers, to ensure staffing performance is meeting or exceeding acceptable standards. Adjust routing schemes and realign resources to optimize coverage and service based on skill set and priority, across multiple sites. Recognizes and initiates escalation processes for routing issues or any other incident and initiates appropriate tactics to ensure service levels are maintained. Provide feedback, analysis and reporting of relevant trends, such as: ticket performance stats, ticket/task arrival patterns, staff productivity, attrition rates and resource allocation. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent 3+ years of program or project management experience Experience in a highly analytical, results-oriented environment with cross functional interactions Knowledge of SQL/Excel at an intermediate level Ability to work on shift work basis Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in BI, finance, engineering, statistics, computer science, mathematics, finance or equivalent quantitative field 3+ years' experience in WFM Real-time Service Level management Experience in coordinating with outsourced service providers Experience in requirement gathering and ability to write clear and detailed requirement document TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

They provide various solutions, including an Automated Multi-Channel Reconciliation Solution, Multi-Bank Connector Solution, FX Conversion for corporations and Financial Institutions, and Cross-Border Payment Rails. Founded in 2017, they envision being Africa's trusted trade infrastructure, unlocking potential and driving prosperity. Headquartered in London, with operational bases in Canada and Nigeria, they provide financial institutions with innovative trade and payment solutions. Description Our client seeks a Sales Operations Analyst/Associate to optimize the sales process, drive pipeline efficiency, and support revenue growth. The ideal candidate will be an expert in HubSpot CRM and leverage data analytics to ensure accurate sales forecasting, CRM hygiene, and overall sales cycle efficiency. This role is integral to streamlining sales operations and enabling sales teams to perform at their highest potential. This position can be based in India or Asia and offers the opportunity to work with a dynamic, high-growth team. Application Process & Qualifying Questions Candidates are required to read the full JD and submit answers to the following qualifying questions along with their CV, required compensation and notice period/availability. Applications without responses to these questions will not be considered: Can you provide evidence of strong experience in setting up and managing HubSpot CRM? What experience do you have in data analysis and supporting B2B sales teams? How have you improved sales pipeline forecasting accuracy in a previous role? What tools or methods did you use? Can you provide an example of when you optimized a sales process or workflow using HubSpot or another CRM? What impact did it have on efficiency or revenue? Responsibilities CRM Management & Sales Process Optimization Own the administration, maintenance, and continuous optimization of HubSpot CRM. Develop and enforce CRM hygiene best practices, ensuring clean, accurate, and up-to-date data. Implement automation tools and workflows within HubSpot to enhance sales productivity. Sales Pipeline & Forecasting Maintain an accurate and reliable sales pipeline, ensuring seamless tracking of deal stages. Develop and refine pipeline forecasting models to enable data-driven decision-making. Provide insights into win/loss analysis, helping to identify bottlenecks and opportunities. Data & Analytics Analyse sales performance metrics and provide actionable insights to improve efficiency. Generate dashboards and reports to track KPIs, including conversion rates and deal velocity. Identify trends and recommend strategies to optimize sales performance. Cross-Functional Collaboration Work closely with sales leadership to improve sales effectiveness and process efficiency. Collaborate with marketing teams to align lead generation strategies with sales objectives. Support finance and operations teams by ensuring accurate revenue tracking and reporting. Training & Enablement Provide training and support to sales teams on HubSpot CRM best practices. Develop training materials and documentation for CRM usage and process adherence. Requirements Minimum of 5 years of experience in sales, business development, and/or partnership roles. Excellent command of the English language Expert-level experience with HubSpot CRM and a deep understanding of sales automation tools. Strong data analysis skills with proficiency in Excel, Google Sheets, or BI tools. Proven experience in B2B sales support, sales operations, or revenue operations. Ability to interpret and visualize data to inform sales strategies and decision-making. Detail-oriented, process-driven, and highly organized with a focus on operational efficiency. Strong communication skills with the ability to collaborate across teams and geographies. Experience working in a high-growth fintech, payments, or SaaS environments is a plus. On Offer Competitive compensation package (Base Salary + Bonus). Flexible/remote working. Opportunity to work with talented professionals in a dynamic and growing industry. Role autonomy and opportunities for professional growth and development. Playing a key role in the leadership and future direction of the organisation.

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impacts on ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Join us. About Trust & Safety Building a world where people can safely discover, create and connect. The Trust & Safety (T&S) team at TikTok helps ensure that our global online community is safe and empowered to create and enjoy content across all of our applications. We have invested heavily in human and machine-based moderation to remove harmful content quickly and often before it reaches our general community. About the Team The Search Operations team aims to improve search user experience, contribute significant DAU impact to the products and drive for increase in traffic and GMV. The Global E-commerce Ops Team is responsible for capturing and identifying users' commerce intentions and operating the whole process to promote GMV. This team focuses on building and strengthening user awareness that they can shop on TikTok, enhance the usage frequency of the search function, and stimulate users' e-commerce search needs, while improving users' search experience, accelerating the e-commerce business to grow. It is possible that this role will be exposed to harmful content as part of the core role/as part of project/ in response to escalation requests/by chance. This may occur in the form of images, video, and text related to every-day life, but it can also include (but is not limited to) bullying; hate speech; child safety; depictions of harm to self and others, and harm to animals. Responsibilities: Operation & Data Management Complete daily operational tasks including quality inspection, policy and process optimization, queue assignment and handling escalations of the labelling project. Work closely with respective project stakeholders and vendors to stay up to date with policy developments and provide feedback on implementation and execution. Performing daily audits on internal systems, monitoring specialist's quality scores and providing analysis of errors and feedback to respective teams (R&D & Product Manager). Monitoring project data, recording daily output and quality scores, preparing data analysis/report of projects as well as validating reports and data provided to stakeholders/partners. Judging user search needs through various queries and tools, and sorting out the classification of requirements. Analyze the difference between search-type results such as goods, videos, hashtags, or users and rate the quality of these results based on policies. While it is assumed the evaluator will focus on their area of expertise, there will be occasions in which he/she will work on projects outside this core area that could require other capabilities, such as using assessment methods flexibly to support related projects. Training Management Localizing the policy guidelines designing training schedules, coordinating and liaise with key stakeholders to ensure that all specialists successfully go-live within the targeted timeframe. Deliver process/product/policy training in classroom and/or virtually to new joiners. Involve in setting up product knowledge tests, sharing result analysis and working with key stakeholders to improve the product knowledge of the team. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Diploma/Degree in any related field. At least 1 year of exposure to search engine optimization, search labelling or any other search related business experience. Proficient English, both written and conversational. Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with search engines and algorithms of any social media platform would be a plus point. An in-depth understanding of the culture and familiarity with the internet usage habits of their users. Comfortable with and understanding that the job requires reviewing internet content that may be deemed inappropriate and / or contain explicit materials. Strong understanding of e-commerce platforms, customer journeys and localization challenges. Excellent identifying problems, problem-solving skills, and learning abilities. Trust & Safety recognises that keeping our platform safe for TikTok communities is no ordinary job which can be both rewarding and psychologically demanding and emotionally taxing for some. This is why we are sharing the potential hazards, risks and implications in this unique line of work from the start, so our candidates are well informed before joining. We are committed to the wellbeing of all our employees and promise to provide comprehensive and evidence-based programs, to promote and support physical and mental wellbeing throughout each employee's journey with us. We believe that wellbeing is a relationship and that everyone has a part to play, so we work in collaboration and consultation with our employees and across our functions in order to ensure a truly person-centred, innovative and integrated approach. TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Job Responsibilities: Job Description Summary Job Description About BD Be part of something bigger! BD is one of the largest global medical device companies in the world and is advancing the world of health by improving medical discovery, diagnostics, and the delivery of care. The BD MMS Service and Support organization provides technical service and field support to BD’s dispensing customers with a mission that’s focused on knowing there’s a patient at the center of everything we do so our pledge is to deliver exceptional service to our customers. Job Description We are the makers of possible BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of healthTM is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities. Why Join Us? A career at BD means learning and working alongside inspirational leaders and colleagues who are equally passionate and committed to fostering an inclusive, growth-centered, and rewarding culture. You will have the opportunity to help shape the trajectory of BD while leaving a legacy at the same time. To find purpose in the possibilities, we need people who can see the bigger picture, who understand the human story that underpins everything we do. We welcome people with the imagination and drive to help us reinvent the future of health. At BD, you’ll discover a culture in which you can learn, grow and thrive. And find satisfaction in doing your part to make the world a better place. Become a maker of possible with us! Job Description: Responsibility To support in building a resilient supply chain and responsible sourcing by mapping all raw materials to mils and to plantations, The work shall help in building supply chain insights, developing landscape programmes on forest and peat restoration, fair labour, net zero and smallholders' inclusion. To process and to collate global supply data, monitor supply of raw materials for all downstream refineries and develop the quarterly internal Traceability Declaration Documents. To maintain up to date traceability datasets of oil palm plantations, mills and Business Units for SDG operations globally. To analyse supply chain data with Geographic Information System (GIS) to verify deforestation allegations, combine external datasets, and communicate progress on sourcing footprints. To assess suppliers’ sustainable sourcing performance using publicly available information and NDPE Implementation Reporting Framework (NDPE-IRF). To disclose progress on traceability, sustainable sourcing performance and initiatives publicly and to respond to customers; queries/questionnaires. To assist in developing carbon footprint accounting and reporting. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in science, business, finance/accounting, engineering or data/information technology. Experience in Sustainability related work is an added advantage. Knowledge in Supply Chain Traceability and Sustainability related field, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint, Power BI, mapping and spatial analysis using QGIS. To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your interest for this role.
